Scuttle.name: Scuttle
Scuttle.description:
Trigger A creature that the giant crab can see targets the crab with an attack

Effect The giant crab scuttles to the side and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. After the attack resolves, the crab can Stride up to its speed in a straight line as part of the reaction.

Parasitized.name: Parasitized
Parasitized.description: Lady Shimmersnip has two giant leeches partly burrowed into her body, making her @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}. These conditions' modifiers can change and aren't reflected in her stat block.

Vulnerable to Prone.name: Vulnerable to Prone
Vulnerable to Prone.description: If a creature critically succeeds on a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} the giant crab, the crab is flipped over onto its back in addition to the usual effects. A giant crab that is flipped onto its back has a particularly hard time defending itself; instead of taking the normal -2 circumstance penalty to AC for being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, it takes a -4 circumstance penalty to AC.

Lady Shimmersnip.name: Lady Shimmersnip
Lady Shimmersnip.publicNotes:
Crabs are scavenging crustaceans known for their hard shells and iconic sideways gait. They use their claws to defend themselves, hunt, and fight other crabs for territory. When confronted with threats from outside their species, most crabs prefer to flee, but when retreat isn't possible, they clamp on to their foes as tightly as they can.

The statistics presented here represent giant crabs that live close to the water's surface. Crabs that live deeper underwater often exhibit more extreme adaptations to their environment. Crabs who live in the depths where little light reaches gain darkvision and cold resistance, and those adapted to the most hostile reaches of the deep sea can detect nearby creatures through subtle shifts in ocean currents.

These skittering creatures are prized for their delicious meat, but their size makes them dangerous targets for harvesting.

Mourn.name: Mourn
Mourn.description:
Trigger A living creature approaches the statue

Effect The trap deals @Damage[(4d10+14)[mental]] damage to all creatures in the room (@Check[will|dc:28|basic] save). On a failed save, a creature additionally falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and begins to weep, taking @Damage[1d10[persistent,mental]] damage.

Unbreakable Sorrow.name: Unbreakable Sorrow
Unbreakable Sorrow.disable: @Check[deception|dc:32] or @Check[performance|dc:32] (master) to laugh away the sadness, @Check[occultism|dc:31] (expert) to banish the psychic imprint, @Check[thievery|dc:33] (master) to disperse the emotional energy
Unbreakable Sorrow.hazarddescription: The PCs hear the sound of sobbing and feel an overwhelming sense of sorrow, as if they'd lost something more precious to them than their own life.

Shambling Onslaught.name: Shambling Onslaught
Shambling Onslaught.description:
1 to 2

Frequency once per round

Effect The shamblers lash out at any enemies in their squares or within @Template[emanation|distance:5]{5 feet} (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(2d6+5)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d6+9)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

Troop Movement.name: Troop Movement
Troop Movement.description: Whenever a troop Strides, it first Forms Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then moves up to its Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square of the troop enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to the whole troop.

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: A shambler troop is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Grave Tide.name: Grave Tide
Grave Tide.description: The shambler troop is less organized than most troops. It can move into other creatures' spaces, and other creatures can move into its spaces. Its spaces are difficult terrain to other creatures.

Putrid Stench.name: Putrid Stench
Putrid Stench.description: 15 feet. The zombies' rotting flesh is particularly malodorous. A creature that enters the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and on a critical failure, the creature also takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. While within the aura, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all zombies' putrid stenches for 1 minute.

Shambler Troop.name: Shambler Troop
Shambler Troop.publicNotes:
This shuffling mass of decaying flesh moves with dull but singular focus.

Necromancers most often create these mindless undead as obedient, expendable servitors. Left to its own devices, a zombie seeks only to consume the living, stopping only when its rotting body can no longer hold together.

Ornery Augdunars.name: 暴动的阿格杜骡群 Ornery Augdunars
Ornery Augdunars.disable: 以任意组合成功通过4次后述检定：@Check[nature|dc:14]（受训）来安抚动物，@Check[intimidation|dc:16]（未受训）来吓跑阿格杜骡，@Check[will|dc:18]（受训）来稳住阵脚并表现出自信心，从而使得阿格杜骡转向离开。对于每次成功，危害都会在攻击检定中承受累计-1点减值。
Ornery Augdunars.hazarddescription: 受惊的阿格杜骡在围场内失控地狂奔，在奔跑途中又咬又踢。
Ornery Augdunars.routine: （2个动作）阿格杜骡群使用一个动作来对一个目标进行啃咬打击，然后它们使用另一个动作对一个不同的目标进行@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]（运动[[/r 1d20+9 #Athletics]]{+9}）。若阿格杜骡群从自身的上个回合开始承受过伤害的话，它们会使用首个动作使用兽蹄踢踏，然后在第二个动作中尝试啃咬打击或摔拌。

Rile.name: 激怒 Rile
Rile.description:
触发 阿格施米克投掷先攻

效果 阿格杜骡群投掷先攻。

Lashing Hooves.name: 兽蹄踢踏 Lashing Hooves
Lashing Hooves.description: 阿格杜骡作出蹄击打击并且将攻击检定结果与至多两个彼此相邻的敌人的AC进行比较。

Dark Naga Venom.name: Dark Naga Venom
Dark Naga Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 5 minutes

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} with no Perception check to wake up ([[/gmr 1d4+1 #minutes]]{1d4+1 minutes})

Guarded Thoughts.name: Guarded Thoughts
Guarded Thoughts.description: Dark nagas are immune to any form of mind reading.

Voxnia.name: Voxnia
Voxnia.publicNotes:
Dark nagas are wicked, jealous creatures that crave power and wealth. Indeed, the dark naga sees such ideals as spiritual expressions of an essential truth: if one can take something, that something is theirs to have. The dark naga sees other creatures as lessers worthy only of subjugation or as rivals who must be eliminated.

Dark nagas dwell in remote places other creatures have forsaken, searching abandoned ruins for wealth and potent magic items. Those unlucky trespassers into a dark naga's lair typically find themselves as the naga's slaves or playthings, put to sleep with the monster's poison or incinerated by its deadly magic. Some dark nagas are more disposed toward socializing than others; in these cases, they may become wicked despots who rule over enclaves of captive or unsuspecting subjects. Subtler dark nagas, especially those who crave finer luxuries, dwell in or under the wealthy settlements and use their wiles to garner a decadent following, forming something akin to a cult with the naga as the jewelry-bedecked object of worship.

Nagas are serpentine beings with magical powers and keen, nearly inscrutable intellects. Physically, they resemble massive snakes with eerie visages that resemble those of humans. Nagas use their innate magic and poisonous fangs to keep all but the most stalwart foes at bay. Beyond the natural weapons they use to ward away foes, little is understood of the naga's unsettling physiology.

Nagas are intelligent creatures with powerful needs to pursue, be they the accumulation of knowledge, the collection of rare art, or the rule of an entire nation. On Golarion, the nation of Nagajor is one such society-an entire empire ruled by nagas and populated by reptilian humanoids who serve their naga rulers with a patriotic pride that borders on worship.

Still, most adventurers interact with nagas on a much smaller scale, encountering them as dangerous guardians in remote locations or not-so-abandoned ruins. In many cases, these nagas have heard of distant Nagajor, but they are usually unwilling to abandon their own pursuits to seek out a land where they might be worshipped as gods.

Ulat-Kini Initiate.name: Ulat-Kini Initiate
Ulat-Kini Initiate.publicNotes:
Several groups of ulat-kinis have rediscovered the ancient way of kirtanang, a martial art from that uses broad, flowing motions of the claws.

Ulat-Kini Culture

The creatures who surface humanoids consider scum still hold grand empires beneath the waves. While some ulat-kinis still revere the alghollthu who created them and others have learned to hate their creators, there are ulat-kinis who have found a new way forward. They have developed their own culture outside of alghollthu influence, founding new underwater traditions and creating new cultural standards.

Flurry of Claws.name: Flurry of Claws
Flurry of Claws.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The ulat-kini initiate makes two claw Strikes against a single target.

Kirtanang.name: Kirtanang
Kirtanang.description: The initiate's Strikes take no penalty from passing through water.

Unfeeling Empath.name: Unfeeling Empath

Goad.name: Goad
Goad.description:
The unfeeling empath floods a creature within 30 feet with countless memories and sensations. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:18] save.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the end of the unfeeling empath's next turn.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Empathic Sense (Precise) 60 feet.name: Empathic Sense (Precise) 60 feet
Empathic Sense (Precise) 60 feet.description: The unfeeling empath perceives all creatures affected by an emotion effect at the listed range.

Emotional Extremes.name: Emotional Extremes
Emotional Extremes.description: If a creature rolls a success at a check to affect an unfeeling empath with an emotion effect, the creature gets a critical success instead. If a creature rolls a failure to affect an unfeeling empath with an emotion effect, the creature gets a critical failure instead. Likewise, when an unfeeling empath rolls a success at a Will save against an emotion effect, it gets a critical success instead. When a unfeeling empath rolls a failure at a Will save against an emotion effect, it gets a critical failure instead.

Drink Emotions.name: Drink Emotions
Drink Emotions.description:
Requirements An enemy is under an emotion effect within 20 feet of the unfeeling empath

Effect The unfeeling empath regains @Damage[1d4[healing]] Hit Points and becomes emotionally excited for 3 rounds. While excited, the unfeeling empath takes a –1 penalty to AC, gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, and deals an additional @Damage[1d4[mental]] damage with its melee Strikes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wL4QI1h4YvdHoOuG]{Effect: Drink Emotions}

Cathartic Howl.name: Cathartic Howl
Cathartic Howl.description:
Requirements The unfeeling empath is under an emotion effect

Effect The unfeeling empath attempts to counteract the emotion effect, with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+11 #Counteract]]{+11}. It then howls, projecting those emotions in a @Template[cone|distance:15] (or a @Template[cone|distance:30] if the unfeeling empath successfully counteracted the emotion effect). Creatures in the area take @Damage[2d8[mental]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[will|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect] save). A creature that critically fails this saving throw also takes @Damage[1d4[mental,persistent]] damage.

Unfeeling Empath.publicNotes:
The soul of a gnome killed by tragedy sometimes becomes so entangled in conflicting emotions that it becomes trapped and reanimates its own corpse. Known as unfeeling empaths, these undead wander in search of others' emotions. When they find thinking prey, they relentlessly goad that creature to elicit and consume their feelings. Though initially harmless, feeding drives an unfeeling empath into an expressive frenzy as they overload the victim's mind, resuming their senses only after their prey is dead.

Misery Loves Company

Unfeeling empaths appreciate any companions who can endure their outbursts. Lost souls and beings who prey on emotions sometimes adopt an unfeeling empath out of solidarity or because the undead gnomes are easy to torment. Thus, where these creatures appear, a sakhil, will-o'-wisp, or ghost is often nearby.

Blood Drain.name: 吸血 Blood Drain
Blood Drain.description:
需求 巨水蛭使一个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]

效果 巨水蛭从被擒抱的生物身上吸血。这造成[[/r 2d4]]伤害，被吸血的生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}状态，直到它受到任何方式的治疗。

Gnash.name: 撕咬 Gnash
Gnash.description:
频率 每轮一次

需求 巨水蛭寄生在闪耀钳女士体内

效果 闪耀钳女士承受@Damage[1[slashing]]伤害，忽视其抗力。

Parasitizing.name: 寄生 Parasitizing
Parasitizing.description: 当处于钻进闪耀钳女士体内的状态时，巨水蛭获得掩蔽，无法作出攻击，但可以撕咬（Gnash）。若巨水蛭陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]、@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]，其它生物就能花费单动作来移除水蛭，这具有攻击和操作特征，尝试1次@Check[athletics|against:fortitude|rollerRole:target]或@Check[medicine|against:fortitude|rollerRole:target]检定对抗巨水蛭的强韧DC。成功时，该生物把水蛭抽出，使得闪耀钳女士的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]状态降低1点，并将水蛭安置在与该生物以及闪耀钳女士相邻的空间内。

Giant Leech.name: 巨水蛭 Giant Leech
Giant Leech.publicNotes: 巨水蛭能长到近5尺的长度，有圆形的口器充满钩一样的牙齿。它们更喜欢生活在死水或流速缓慢的浅水中，或潮湿潮湿的矮树丛中。马和大型动物是它们最喜欢的猎物，但当它们有机会捕猎人类或半个人大小的食物时也毫不畏惧。

Enraged Polar Bear Spirit.hazarddescription: The ghostly spirit of a polar bear stands on its hind legs and roars.
Enraged Polar Bear Spirit.routine: (3 actions) The bear moves around the room at an alarming speed, seemingly teleporting, and Strikes a random creature with its spiritual claws.
Enraged Polar Bear Spirit.reset: The bear spirit calms after no creatures are in the room for 1 minute but is ready to lash out again after 10 minutes.

Feral Roar.name: Feral Roar
Feral Roar.description:
Trigger A creature approaches within 10 feet of the polar bear spirit

Effect The polar bear spirit roars. Each creature in the room must attempt a @Check[will|dc:28] save. The enraged polar bear spirit rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[6d6[sonic]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[12d6[sonic]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

Enraged Polar Bear Spirit.name: Enraged Polar Bear Spirit
Enraged Polar Bear Spirit.disable: @Check[nature|dc:26] (expert) to calm the spirit, @Check[intimidate|dc:30] (master) to cow the spirit, or @Check[religion|dc:30] (expert) to contain the spiritual corruption (each successful check reduces its number of actions by 1)

Inexorable Door.name: 牢固铁门 Inexorable Door
Inexorable Door.hazarddescription: 藏在墙壁之内的机械会缓慢地将两扇铁门闭合起来，并在之后的24小时内加以固定。

equipment-Amulet.name: Amulet
equipment-Amulet.description: Relics are a special type of magic item that can grow in power as their wielders unlock additional abilities. The full rules for relics and their aspects begin on page 94 of the Gamemastery Guide.

Death Gaze.name: Death Gaze
Death Gaze.description:
The spirit targets a creature it can see within 30 feet, dealing to it @Damage[4d6[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:20|basic] save).

A creature with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.TTCw5NusiSSkJU1x]{Void Healing} instead regains @Damage[4d6[healing]] Hit Points and is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

Manifest.name: Manifest
Manifest.description:
Requirements The relic detects at least one creature using its lifesense.

Effect The spirit within the relic manifests in an open space within 10 feet of the amulet. When it does, the relic teleports around its neck. The spirit remains in its manifested state until it no longer senses any living creatures within range of its lifesense.

Clan Dagger Relic.name: Clan Dagger Relic
Clan Dagger Relic.description: The corrupted relic is Taargick's clan dagger rather than an amulet. When the spirit Manifests, the clan dagger teleports into its hand. The clan dagger can be targeted by Strikes (AC 21, Hardness 8, HP 20, BT 10).

Sudden Manifestation.name: Sudden Manifestation
Sudden Manifestation.description:
Trigger The relic detects a creature using its lifesense.

Effect The relic Manifests. If this causes an encounter to begin, the relic gains a +4 status bonus to its initiative roll.

Blood Accusation.name: Blood Accusation
Blood Accusation.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet of the corrupted blade spirit takes persistent bleed damage

Effect The corrupted blade spirit shapes the spilled blood into words that remind the bleeding creature of their fears, mistakes, and shames. The corrupted blade spirit Demoralizes the creature, additionally dealing @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage on a critical success.

Corrupted Blade Spirit.name: Corrupted Blade Spirit
Corrupted Blade Spirit.publicNotes:
Creatures that once held particular items dear can be bound to them after death, their souls inhabiting the item from within. These might be the faithful haunting symbols of their faith, warriors clinging to their old weapons, or the greedy inhabiting their precious wealth. These spirits' physical bodies have long since degraded, but they keep their corrupted relics pristine. The spirits manifest on the unsuspecting or curious, determined to destroy anyone who would dare show any interest in their one precious possession.

Though rare, there are several kinds of corrupted relics. The bound spirit can manifest in different ways, from animating an ancient weapon to possessing anyone who dons the item. Destroying the relic often ends up being the simplest, most direct way to banish the haunt itself. Destroying or dispelling the spirit without destroying the relic, however, can sometimes leave priceless treasure behind.

The amulet shown here has the air and death aspects. Its minor gifts, deadly spark and death gaze, power some of the spirit's abilities. Someone who claims the relic might gain different gifts from those aspects.

Personality Cage.name: Personality Cage
Personality Cage.description: A soulbound mauler encapsulates an entire soul within its soul focus gem, with that soul's personality and past shining through along with a confusing mix of fragmented memories and instincts. This causes a soulbound mauler to match the donor soul's alignment and gain the corresponding alignment traits. When the mauler doesn't have a soul bound, it's inanimate.

Eager Rend.name: Eager Rend
Eager Rend.description:
The soulbound mauler has a living creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

Effect The soulbound mauler holds the creature it has grabbed and attempts to tear it in two. That creature takes @Damage[5d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:18|basic]). On a critical failure, the target also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

Tethered Soul.name: Tethered Soul
Tethered Soul.description: The soul focus gem that powers a soulbound mauler is tethered with eight ectoplasmic leashes inside an open cavity in the creature's chest. It can be targeted directly with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} action. Rather than the normal result of these actions, the soulbound mauler takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} on a success; on a critical success, it takes @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Soulbound Mauler (Neutral Good).name: Soulbound Mauler (Neutral Good)
Soulbound Mauler (Neutral Good).publicNotes:
If a soulbound doll isn't large and strong enough for one's needs, there's the oversized soulbound mauler. An upgrade to the soulbound doll, this mannequin is powered by the entire soul of a sapient creature. Many a necromancer has attempted to use these constructs as a method to live forever, likely as a shortcut around the complicated and ultimately morbid path to lichdom. However, the soul within the mannequin has problems properly expressing itself and displays rudimentary control over the host, often resulting in childlike behavior anywhere from curious to sadistic.

Rather than embedding the soul focus gem in the construct's neck or chest, it's tethered by bands of ectoplasm within an exposed chamber on the mannequin's chest. Until the soulbound mauler is destroyed, the focus gem cannot be removed from the empty cavity in its chest. However, the gem can be displaced which causes the soulbound mauler significant anguish, not only damaging the connection between the gem and artificial body, but also impairing the construct's ability to function.

Innate Spells

Like a soulbound doll, a soulbound mauler gains an additional 3rd-rank innate spell depending on its alignment, as listed below.

Lawful Good: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal}

Neutral Good: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Q7QQ91vQtyi1Ux36]{Jump}

Chaotic Good: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o6YCGx4lycsYpww4]{Haste}

Lawful Neutral: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VosLNn2M8S7JH67D]{Blindness}

Neutral: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.I0j56TNRmGcTyoqJ]{Shared Invisibility}

Chaotic Neutral: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter}

Lawful Evil: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WsUwpfmhKrKwoIe3]{Slow}

Neutral Evil: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GKpEcy9WId6NJvtx]{Stinking Cloud}

Chaotic Evil: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm}

Relentless.name: Relentless
Relentless.description: When a juvenile cave worm gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} condition, reduce the duration by half, to a minimum of 1 round. It also recovers from penalties to its Speeds and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition at the end of its turn. Finally, it ignores non-magical difficult terrain and treats greater difficult terrain like difficult terrain.

Ferocious Gnaw.description: Each foe in the larval swarm's space takes @Damage[(6d6)[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save).
Ferocious Gnaw.name: Ferocious Gnaw

Pummeling Thrash.name: Pummeling Thrash
Pummeling Thrash.description:
Requirements The larval swarm's most recent action was Ferocious Gnaw

Effect The larval swarm frantically thrashes in an effort to consume its prey. The larval swarm attempts an @Check[athletics|defense:reflex] check and compares the result to the Reflex DC of each creature in its space.

Critical Success The creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and take @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

Success The creature falls prone and takes @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

Shake It Off.name: Shake It Off
Shake It Off.description:
Trigger The larval cave worm brood would be affected by a condition or adverse effect (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dN8QBNuTiaBHCKUe]{Cursed Metamorphosis})

Effect The larval brood negates the triggering condition or effect. Effects from artifacts, deities, or a similarly powerful source can't be avoided in this way.

Larval Cave Worm Brood (Glacial).name: Larval Cave Worm Brood (Glacial)
Larval Cave Worm Brood (Glacial).publicNotes:
While gestating, cave worms adapt to their surrounding environments, becoming accustomed to extreme temperatures and hazards nearby. For example, cave worms hatched in volcanic environments mature into crimson worms, while those raised near water sources mature into azure worms. Regardless of their environment, larval cave worms all have translucent bodies and pallid carapaces that harden and change color as they mature. When a brood of cave worms hatches from their eggs, the foot-long worms mass together, forming a swarm of ravenous larval worms. This swarm travels ceaselessly, consuming anything in its path. The young are drawn to movement, as living, squirming prey tends to be the most nutritious. As they age, they incorporate more minerals into their diet to support carapace growth.

Cave worms are gigantic scavengers who shape their environment as they bore through rock, ice, or other substances on their search for food. These behemoths consume everything in their path. Though they usually prefer soil, minerals, and occasionally constructed buildings, they will also eat living creatures, plants, and other organic materials. There are numerous species of cave worms, each a different color and perfectly adapted to their surrounding environment. Cave worms rarely exceed a typical animal's intelligence. They're also poor parents that lay a clutch of eggs sealed in a protein shell before abandoning them. After a short incubation period, the young hatch, forming a swarming mass of ravenous larval cave worms. When nearing maturity or when starved of sufficiently rich soil, these larval worms turn on one another. They fight for dominance or flee until only a few remain. The survivors grow quickly, rapidly becoming juvenile cave worms.

Brood Variance

The cave worms presented here are typical of standard rock worms. For crimson worms, use the elite adjustment and add immunity to fire. For azure worms, increase their swim Speed to 40. Gray worms gain void healing and a weakness to vitality energy 5. Glacial worms gain immunity to cold.

Early Hatchling

A single cave worm egg can produce several thousand larval cave worms when it slowly matures over a millennia. However, if a cave worm egg is disturbed or damaged before its natural cycle completes, the egg enters a rapid stage of maturation. Only a few hundred worms survive this process, creating significantly fewer offspring than when allowed to mature slowly.

Tormenter.name: Tormenter
Tormenter.description: Bronwyl deals an additional 2d6 mental damage with weapon Strikes against creatures that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied}, or have persistent damage.

Occult Catharsis.name: Occult Catharsis
Occult Catharsis.description: Krohan's magic converts his pain into spellpower. After he casts an innate occult spell, he attempts a @Check[flat|dc:5], increasing the DC by twice the spell's rank if it was not a cantrip. On a success, Krohan's Spirits Drawn to Suffering effect ends; he can reduce the value of one condition affecting him by 1, and he regains @Damage[2d6[healing]] Hit Points.

Spirits Drawn to Suffering.name: Spirits Drawn to Suffering
Spirits Drawn to Suffering.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Trigger Krohan critically fails a saving throw, takes mental damage, takes damage from a critical hit, or gains a harmful condition with a numerical value (such as frightened or sickened). This effect does not trigger due to self-harm or similarly engineered circumstances.

Effect Krohan gains the ability to cast his innate occult spells for 1 minute.

Unwitting Rivethun.name: Unwitting Rivethun
Unwitting Rivethun.description: Krohan has very limited access to Rivethun magic, able to cast spells only when experiencing pain or distress.

Righthand Man.name: Righthand Man
Righthand Man.description: Krohan gains a +2 circumstance bonus to attack rolls and skill checks attempted to Aid others. He can attempt a Dwarf Lore check in place of any other attack roll or skill check to Aid a dwarf.

Shake It Off.name: Shake It Off
Shake It Off.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The juvenile cave worm would be affected by a condition or adverse effect (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dN8QBNuTiaBHCKUe]{Cursed Metamorphosis})

Effect The juvenile cave worm negates the triggering condition or effect. Effects from artifacts, deities, or a similarly powerful source can't be avoided in this way.

Clumsy Leap.name: Clumsy Leap
Clumsy Leap.description: The cave worm flings its body, Leaping 30 feet. If it lands next to a creature, it can Strike that creature with its jaws. If the jaws Strike fails, it can Strike with its body using the same multiple attack penalty as the failed jaws Strike, but it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of its next turn.

Rock Tunneler.name: Rock Tunneler
Rock Tunneler.description: A juvenile cave worm can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 10 feet. It can leave a tunnel if it desires, and it usually does.

Relentless.name: Relentless
Relentless.description: When a juvenile cave worm gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} condition, reduce the duration by half, to a minimum of 1 round. It also recovers from penalties to its Speeds and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition at the end of its turn. Finally, it ignores non-magical difficult terrain and treats greater difficult terrain like difficult terrain.

Killing Shake.name: Killing Shake
Killing Shake.description:
Requirements The juvenile cave worm has a Medium or smaller creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The juvenile cave Juvenile Cave Worm worm shakes the creature back and forth quickly, tearing flesh with its multiple rows of teeth. The target takes @Damage[(2d12+9)[slashing]] damage and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If the creature is adjacent to a solid surface, such as a stone wall, it takes an additional @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]] damage. The creature attempts a @Check[reflex|dc:23|basic] save against all damage; if the creature succeeds, it isn't knocked prone.

Juvenile Cave Worm (Crimson).name: Juvenile Cave Worm (Crimson)
Juvenile Cave Worm (Crimson).publicNotes:
A juvenile cave worm has left its brood or eaten them, and has started to establish its own territory, hunting in regular intervals. These young worms tend to be more aggressive towards other life forms than their relatively mellow adult kin.

Avernal Flashback.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:22], @Check[occultism|dc:22], or @Check[religion|dc:22]; it takes three successful checks to weaken the haunt or erect supports that brace the ceiling. A PC who speaks Dwarven can attempt @Check[diplomacy|dc:22] (trained) checks to calm the phantasmal cave worm.
Avernal Flashback.name: Avernal Flashback
Avernal Flashback.hazarddescription: A phantasmal crimson worm appears to rampage outside the workshop, afflicting the area with phantom tremors, blistering heat, and cave-ins.
Avernal Flashback.routine: (2 actions) Zogototaru uses 1 action to create a Tremor. With her other action, she either Exudes Heat or makes Rocks Fall, alternating between the two each round.

Exude Heat.name: Exude Heat
Exude Heat.description: Zogototaru breathes fire across Guldrege. Even from a distance, this makes the area blisteringly hot, dealing @Damage[3d6[fire]] damage to all creatures (@Check[fortitude|dc:22|basic] save).

Rocks Fall.name: Rocks Fall
Rocks Fall.description: Zogototaru's thrashing appears to crack the roof, dropping debris on a random creature in the area. This deals @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save).

Tremor.name: Tremor
Tremor.description: Zogototaru's thrashing shakes the ground, knocking creatures @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} in the area unless they succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:20] save.

Bestial Transformation.name: Bestial Transformation
Bestial Transformation.disable: @Check[nature|dc:26] (expert) to handle the animal carvings or @Check[thievery|dc:33] (master) to scratch out the animal carvings or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (5th rank; counteract DC 28) to counteract the spell
Bestial Transformation.hazarddescription: Enchanted carvings of animals transform any creatures who damage the door into the animal they harmed.

Animal Form.name: Animal Form
Animal Form.description:
Trigger A creature damages the door

Effect The trap casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VuPDHoVEPLbMfCJC]{Bestial Curse} on the triggering creature (@Check[fortitude|dc:32|traits:arcane,curse,polymorph,transmutation] save); on a critical failure, the duration is 2 hours.

Thrash.name: Thrash
Thrash.description:
Zogototaru lashes her body, rattling the ground and splashing magma in a @Template[cone|distance:30]. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:29] save.

Critical Success No effect.

Success The creature takes @Damage[4d6[fire]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d6[fire]] damage and @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage and @Damage[6d6[bludgeoning]] damage, and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Special The first time she Thrashes, Zogototaru destroys the pillars in area F2a. Anyone there can leap free as part of their Reflex saving throw, landing on the closest surface. For the remainder of combat, the rear half of the crimson worm's body floats in the magma there, creating an improvised bridge 10 feet wide and 30 feet long. Creatures on Zogototaru take a –2 circumstance penalty to their Reflex saves against her Thrashing.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.QzJv3TybABeCjwQc]{Effect: Riding Zogototaru}

Rescue.name: Rescue
Rescue.description: Zogototaru lunges near Narseigus, flips him atop her head, and recoils. This moves Narseigus up to 30 feet horizontally and positions him atop Zogototaru, treating her head as a 10-by-10-foot space that's 20 feet above the magma's surface. This movement triggers reactions based on the move trait, targeting Narseigus. Zogototaru continues supporting Narseigus until ordered to perform a different action, after which she deposits him in a safe location within 30 feet as a free action. A PC can Climb (@Check[athletics|dc:25]) Zogototaru's coarse hide to reach him.

Roar.name: Roar
Roar.description:
Zogototaru looms and screeches ferociously. Creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:60] take @Damage[6d6[sonic]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:29|basic] save) and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:29] save.

Critical Success No effect.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

Zogototaru.name: Zogototaru
Zogototaru.disable: Disable @Check[arcana|dc:28] or @Check[occultism|dc:28] (trained) to identify a loophole in mind-controlling magic, @Check[diplomacy|dc:30] to reason with Zogototaru, or @Check[deception|dc:31] or @Check[performance|dc:31] to speak as if the PC were Taargick
Zogototaru.hazarddescription: Narseigus's worm-calling enchantments have attained imperfect control over Zogototaru, compelling her to aid him. She follows his directions loosely and with little finesse.
Zogototaru.routine: (1 action) Zogototaru acts on Narseigus's most recent command, either Rescuing, Roaring, or Thrashing.

Hryngar Assassin.name: Hryngar Assassin
Hryngar Assassin.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Disengaging Shot.name: Disengaging Shot
Disengaging Shot.description:
Requirements The hryngar assassin is equipped with a loaded repeating heavy crossbow

Trigger A creature critically misses the hryngar assassin with a melee Strike

Effect The hryngar assassin Strides, then Strikes the triggering creature with their repeating heavy crossbow; the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against this Strike.

Sneak Attack.description: The hryngar assassin deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.
Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack

Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the hryngar assassin.

Hryngar Assassin.publicNotes:
In secret conclaves around Nar-Voth, hidden in plain sight within hryngar settlements, are the workshops and training grounds for the Darklands' most technologically sophisticated group of killers. Most hryngar assassins train from childhood, having been recruited from orphanages, and are under a life-debt obligation to their guild leader. While on contract, hryngar assassins are on the lookout for new technologies, gadgets, and alchemical creations. They bring what they find back to their guild to be reverse engineered and replicated for other guild assassins. When the opportunity presents itself, they destroy the schematics and formulae that other organizations, inventors, and alchemists have created if they can't steal them.

Deep under the surface of Golarion, dwarves still dwell in the darkness. Once abandoned by their kin who were obsessed with reaching the surface, these dwarves have found that by working harder than their brethren, they can build a society far greater than anything under the sun. Droskar, Master of the Dark Furnace, teaches them that toiling for their masters, who in turn toil for their masters above, will lead all of them to become stronger than ever. Every hryngar knows that their labor defines them, and brings them glory in the eyes of Droskar and their peers. Exhaustion at the end of the work day is an honor, proof of their worth in society.

Bleeding Edge Killing Tech

Hryngar assassins use the most advanced gadgets and technology available to them. Their inventors are hard at work reverse engineering any specialized equipment they find so they can provide moderately equivalent designs to the best assassins. Elite assassins gain one consumable gadget (Pathfinder Guns & Gears) of their level or lower, often selected for a specific job.

Personality Cage.description: A soulbound mauler encapsulates an entire soul within its soul focus gem, with that soul's personality and past shining through along with a confusing mix of fragmented memories and instincts. This causes a soulbound mauler to match the donor soul's alignment and gain the corresponding alignment traits. When the mauler doesn't have a soul bound, it's inanimate.
Personality Cage.name: Personality Cage

Eager Rend.name: Eager Rend
Eager Rend.description:
The soulbound mauler has a living creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

Effect The soulbound mauler holds the creature it has grabbed and attempts to tear it in two. That creature takes @Damage[5d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:18|basic]). On a critical failure, the target also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

Tethered Soul.name: Tethered Soul
Tethered Soul.description: The soul focus gem that powers a soulbound mauler is tethered with eight ectoplasmic leashes inside an open cavity in the creature's chest. It can be targeted directly with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} action. Rather than the normal result of these actions, the soulbound mauler takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} on a success; on a critical success, it takes @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Soulbound Mauler (Neutral Evil).name: Soulbound Mauler (Neutral Evil)
Soulbound Mauler (Neutral Evil).publicNotes:
If a soulbound doll isn't large and strong enough for one's needs, there's the oversized soulbound mauler. An upgrade to the soulbound doll, this mannequin is powered by the entire soul of a sapient creature. Many a necromancer has attempted to use these constructs as a method to live forever, likely as a shortcut around the complicated and ultimately morbid path to lichdom. However, the soul within the mannequin has problems properly expressing itself and displays rudimentary control over the host, often resulting in childlike behavior anywhere from curious to sadistic.

Rather than embedding the soul focus gem in the construct's neck or chest, it's tethered by bands of ectoplasm within an exposed chamber on the mannequin's chest. Until the soulbound mauler is destroyed, the focus gem cannot be removed from the empty cavity in its chest. However, the gem can be displaced which causes the soulbound mauler significant anguish, not only damaging the connection between the gem and artificial body, but also impairing the construct's ability to function.

Innate Spells

Like a soulbound doll, a soulbound mauler gains an additional 3rd-rank innate spell depending on its alignment, as listed below.

Lawful Good: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal}

Neutral Good: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Q7QQ91vQtyi1Ux36]{Jump}

Chaotic Good: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o6YCGx4lycsYpww4]{Haste}

Lawful Neutral: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VosLNn2M8S7JH67D]{Blindness}

Neutral: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.I0j56TNRmGcTyoqJ]{Shared Invisibility}

Chaotic Neutral: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter}

Lawful Evil: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WsUwpfmhKrKwoIe3]{Slow}

Neutral Evil: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GKpEcy9WId6NJvtx]{Stinking Cloud}

Chaotic Evil: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm}

Coal Residue.name: 残留烟煤 Coal Residue
Coal Residue.disable: @Check[mining-lore|dc:15]（受训）来将惰性材料洒在该区域或@Check[survival|dc:18]来撬开足够的原料来防止连锁反应。
Coal Residue.hazarddescription: 可燃原料会被点燃并剧烈燃烧。

Ignite.name: 燃烧 Ignite
Ignite.description:
触发 区域内的效果造成至少@Damage[8[electricity]]伤害或@Damage[4[fire]]伤害

效果 碎煤迅速燃烧，对区域内的所有生物造成@Damage[4d6[fire]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic]豁免）。该区域会燃烧1分钟，在此期间，该区域的生物获得隐蔽，其他生物对它们来说获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]，在该区域结束回合的生物会承受@Damage[1d6[fire]]伤害。

If the jaws Strike fails, it can Strike with its body using the same multiple attack penalty as the failed jaws Strike, but it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of its next turn.

Rock Tunneler.name: Rock Tunneler
Rock Tunneler.description: A juvenile cave worm can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 10 feet. It can leave a tunnel if it desires, and it usually does.

Juvenile Cave Worm (Glacial).name: Juvenile Cave Worm (Glacial)
Juvenile Cave Worm (Glacial).publicNotes:
A juvenile cave worm has left its brood or eaten them, and has started to establish its own territory, hunting in regular intervals. These young worms tend to be more aggressive towards other life forms than their relatively mellow adult kin.

Cave worms are gigantic scavengers who shape their environment as they bore through rock, ice, or other substances on their search for food. These behemoths consume everything in their path. Though they usually prefer soil, minerals, and occasionally constructed buildings, they will also eat living creatures, plants, and other organic materials. There are numerous species of cave worms, each a different color and perfectly adapted to their surrounding environment. Cave worms rarely exceed a typical animal's intelligence. They're also poor parents that lay a clutch of eggs sealed in a protein shell before abandoning them. After a short incubation period, the young hatch, forming a swarming mass of ravenous larval cave worms. When nearing maturity or when starved of sufficiently rich soil, these larval worms turn on one another. They fight for dominance or flee until only a few remain. The survivors grow quickly, rapidly becoming juvenile cave worms.

Brood Variance

The cave worms presented here are typical of standard rock worms. For crimson worms, use the elite adjustment and add immunity to fire. For azure worms, increase their swim Speed to 40. Gray worms gain void healing and a weakness to vitality energy 5. Glacial worms gain immunity to cold.

Early Hatchling

A single cave worm egg can produce several thousand larval cave worms when it slowly matures over a millennia. However, if a cave worm egg is disturbed or damaged before its natural cycle completes, the egg enters a rapid stage of maturation. Only a few hundred worms survive this process, creating significantly fewer offspring than when allowed to mature slowly.

Riled by Disrespect.description: 若有生物连至少一项美化先祖回响被束缚之地的任务都没有执行过的话，先祖回响对抗该生物时的攻击检定和豁免检定DC获得+1状态加值。这适用于在清洁区域D2的一次或多次检定中未曾成功过的任何PC。
Riled by Disrespect.name: 不敬怒火 Riled by Disrespect

Site Bound.name: 束缚之地 Site Bound
Site Bound.description: 先祖回响无法离开上层墓室。

Rejuvenation.name: 复生 Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: 修复被篡改的铭文并吟诵修正后的他们的故事，引领这些精魂前往来世。

Ancient Anecdote.name: 古代轶事 Ancient Anecdote
Ancient Anecdote.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 奥柯珀苏引用一件被遗忘的轶事来对60尺内的1个生物打趣。该生物必须尝试@Check[will|dc:18]豁免检定或者@Check[dwarf-lore|dc:15]检定。

成功 目标不受影响。

失败 目标为了试图辨别被引用的事情陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}。

大失败 轶事让目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}，持续1轮。

Rile Augdunars.description:
1或2

频率 每轮一次

效果 阿格施米克刺激动物们并激起它们的怒火。她尝试@Check[flat|dc:11]检定（如果使用双动作则为@Check[flat|dc:6]）。若成功，她会使得PC们用于解除危害的1个成功检定失效。该动作会产生足够大的噪音，使得尝试@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]阿格施米克的PC能够侦测到她，即便她此时并不在该名PC正在搜索的区域之内也无妨。
Rile Augdunars.name: 激怒阿格杜骡 Rile Augdunars

Tremorsense (Imprecise) within their ent.name: 颤动感知（模糊感官）身处所连结的院子时 Tremorsense (Imprecise) within their entire bound yard

Master of the Yard.name: 一院之主 Master of the Yard
Master of the Yard.description:
院子里住着一只友善的院老儿是件很幸运的事情，因为院老儿院老儿会帮忙挤奶或保护工具。这样的院子不会发生任何类似于火灾这样的意外事故。并且在这里进行的任何@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]、@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]、@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.bT3skovyLUtP22ME]、或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.49y9Ec4bDii8pcD3]检定都会获得+2环境加值。但如果院老儿对你并不友好，那么反之，以上这些检定将会受到-2环境减值，因为宅老儿会惊吓奶牛，在你睡觉的时候制造噪音，或破坏工具，并用各种小手段给你的生活带去折磨。

仅当院老儿在一个地方待上了超过一周后，该能力才会生效。

Shy.name: 腼腆 Shy
Shy.description: 院老儿在其所联结的房舍中是天然@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]的。他们可以选择主动显形给部分或所有人看见。

Algerschmick.name: 阿格施米克 Algerschmick
Algerschmick.publicNotes:
在民俗传统中，院老儿通常被视为是宅老儿的弟弟，负责打理农民们的院子以及里头所有的牲畜与工具。那些受院老儿宠爱的牲畜会变得健康、强壮、温驯，而那些不受宠的呢则会被折腾得萎靡不振、痛苦不堪。所以对于那些家里住着院老儿的家庭来说，他们在饲养新牲畜时要做的第一件事情，就是一定要把这些新成员介绍给院老儿认识，并在院棚里留下饭菜以安抚这位家灵。院老儿特别讨厌长着白毛的动物，所以会赶走那些纯白的牛和马，但对于长着白色羽毛的鸡而言，他们并不会有类似的厌恶。

家灵是一种腼腆怕生的精类，多数情况下都很乐于助人，偶尔也会发怒，平常就与村野农夫们为伴。他们会把家安在宅子、院子、粮仓、澡堂以及任何类似的人们所建造并生活于此的地方。由于平时和人们生活在一个屋檐下，所以家灵们时常会模仿其生活环境里凡人们的举止和外貌。由于他们天性喜欢隐居也鲜少为人亲眼所见，神出鬼没的故而得了个“灵”魂的灵字，但实际上他们真的只是一群有着实在躯体的精类而已。

家灵们对“属于他们的”凡人如同父母一样无微不至。只要得到了适当的尊重，这些精类就会为他们的“被监护人”不知疲倦地劳作——劈柴、饲畜、缝纫、扫地、烧炉，啥都干。不过呢，如果凡人们触怒了他们，这些家灵们就会成为平淡生活里的小炸弹，到处去惊吓家里的动物和孩子，还会破坏家中财物以发泄不满。

Soulbound Mauler (Chaotic Neutral).name: Soulbound Mauler (Chaotic Neutral)

Personality Cage.description: A soulbound mauler encapsulates an entire soul within its soul focus gem, with that soul's personality and past shining through along with a confusing mix of fragmented memories and instincts. This causes a soulbound mauler to match the donor soul's alignment and gain the corresponding alignment traits. When the mauler doesn't have a soul bound, it's inanimate.
Personality Cage.name: Personality Cage

Eager Rend.name: Eager Rend
Eager Rend.description:
The soulbound mauler has a living creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

Effect The soulbound mauler holds the creature it has grabbed and attempts to tear it in two. That creature takes @Damage[5d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:18|basic]). On a critical failure, the target also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

Tethered Soul.name: Tethered Soul
Tethered Soul.description: The soul focus gem that powers a soulbound mauler is tethered with eight ectoplasmic leashes inside an open cavity in the creature's chest. It can be targeted directly with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} action. Rather than the normal result of these actions, the soulbound mauler takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} on a success; on a critical success, it takes @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Soulbound Mauler (Chaotic Neutral).publicNotes:
If a soulbound doll isn't large and strong enough for one's needs, there's the oversized soulbound mauler. An upgrade to the soulbound doll, this mannequin is powered by the entire soul of a sapient creature. Many a necromancer has attempted to use these constructs as a method to live forever, likely as a shortcut around the complicated and ultimately morbid path to lichdom. However, the soul within the mannequin has problems properly expressing itself and displays rudimentary control over the host, often resulting in childlike behavior anywhere from curious to sadistic.

Rather than embedding the soul focus gem in the construct's neck or chest, it's tethered by bands of ectoplasm within an exposed chamber on the mannequin's chest. Until the soulbound mauler is destroyed, the focus gem cannot be removed from the empty cavity in its chest. However, the gem can be displaced which causes the soulbound mauler significant anguish, not only damaging the connection between the gem and artificial body, but also impairing the construct's ability to function.

Innate Spells

Like a soulbound doll, a soulbound mauler gains an additional 3rd-rank innate spell depending on its alignment, as listed below.

Lawful Good: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal}

Neutral Good: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Q7QQ91vQtyi1Ux36]{Jump}

Chaotic Good: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o6YCGx4lycsYpww4]{Haste}

Lawful Neutral: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VosLNn2M8S7JH67D]{Blindness}

Neutral: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.I0j56TNRmGcTyoqJ]{Shared Invisibility}

Chaotic Neutral: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter}

Lawful Evil: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WsUwpfmhKrKwoIe3]{Slow}

Neutral Evil: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GKpEcy9WId6NJvtx]{Stinking Cloud}

Chaotic Evil: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm}

Rock Tunneler.name: Rock Tunneler
Rock Tunneler.description: Stoneriver can burrow through solid stone, leaving behind a tunnel if he desires.

Swallow Whole.name: Swallow Whole
Swallow Whole.description:
Large, @Damage[6d6[bludgeoning],2d6[fire]]{6d6 bludgeoning plus 2d6 fire} and devour magic, Rupture 40

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Bolster Torag's Chosen.name: Bolster Torag's Chosen
Bolster Torag's Chosen.description: 20 feet. Dwarves and creatures that worship Torag in the area gain a +1 status bonus to AC and Will saves.

Devour Magic.name: Devour Magic
Devour Magic.description: Whenever Stoneriver deals damage with Swallow Whole, he consumes one of the swallowed creature's magical effects, as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} with a [[/r 1d20+21 #Counteract]]{+21} counteract modifier.

Measure Soul.name: Measure Soul
Measure Soul.description: Stoneriver mentally pries through the mind of a creature within 60 feet, dealing @Damage[10d8[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:29|basic] save). Stoneriver can choose to make this damage nonlethal or choose not to damage the creature at all. For 1 minute, Stoneriver gains a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and Perception checks against that creature. If the creature is evil and it failed its save, the creature is additionally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4} on a critical failure). Stoneriver can't use Measure Soul again for 1d4 rounds.

Stoneriver.name: Stoneriver
Stoneriver.publicNotes:
A servant of Torag, Stoneriver resembles a pangolin with glowing blue eyes and brassy, rune-covered scales. Stoneriver burrows through Golarion's mantle and crust as he hunts down subterranean fiends, aids virtuous communities, and defends sacred sites, often collaborating with dwarves.

Forgeheart Five

Stoneriver has fathered numerous children through the years, each clever, brave, and bold. Among these, five have joined together to combat evil as a team. Calling themselves the Forgeheart Five, these overly optimistic and bombastic creatures strive to be as virtuous and heroic as their father. Thus far, their methods have been more flashy than effective.
Stoneriver.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

Vulnerability to Exorcism.description: When a toilforged sentinel fails a saving throw against a spell that would banish tormented spirits or manipulate souls, such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.bay4AfSu2iIozNNW]{Banishment} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Seize Soul}, instead of experiencing the listed effect, it takes 10 damage per spell rank.
Vulnerability to Exorcism.name: Vulnerability to Exorcism

Droskar's Grasp.name: Droskar's Grasp
Droskar's Grasp.description: The toilforged sentinel can Grab a creature using only one hand. It can move normally with a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in its claw, carrying the creature along. If it has a creature grabbed in this way, it can't use its claw Strike. It activates Swallow Whole with its claw by depositing a grabbed creature into its soul furnace.

Find the Faithless (Imprecise) 60 Feet.name: Find the Faithless (Imprecise) 60 Feet
Find the Faithless (Imprecise) 60 Feet.description: The toilforged sentinel detects the presence of creatures that don't worship Droskar within 60 feet as an imprecise sense.

Exertion Aura.name: Exertion Aura
Exertion Aura.description: 20 feet. A toilforged sentinel saps the energy of nearby creatures. Each round a living creature begins its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save. On a failure, the creature takes @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage (@Damage[2d6[mental]]{2d6} on a critical failure) and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}. This fatigue ends as soon as the creature remains outside of the aura for 1 minute.

Soul Furnace.name: Soul Furnace
Soul Furnace.description: The toilforged sentinel has a cage incorporated into its central body, filled with profane fire and called a soul furnace. As long as a toilforged sentinels' soul furnace contains a living creature, the toilforged sentinel is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} (Stride or Strike).

Toilforged Sentinel.name: Toilforged Sentinel
Toilforged Sentinel.publicNotes:
Toilforged sentinels are intelligent war machines painstakingly constructed from iron, steel, and other metals over the course of a full year. With twin treads, a central cage filled with eternal flames, and numerous weapons (including a hammer, cannon, and grasping claw capable of snatching up foes), a toilforged sentinel is an intimidating sight. Creatures consumed by a sentinel's flames become captives, their souls eternally bound to the flames, powering the device. Such souls are freed upon the sentinel's destruction.

Salvation

Toilforged sentinels are religious constructs created to destroy heretics: those who refuse to worship Droskar. They take orders only from the clergy of Droskar and find particular satisfaction from consuming worshippers of Torag and other dwarven deities.

Mumkuh.name: Mumkuh

Shamble Forth!.name: Shamble Forth!
Shamble Forth!.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Each zombie controlled by the zombie lord Strides 5 feet (or Burrows, Climbs, Flies, or Swims 5 feet if it has the corresponding movement type).

Zombie Commander.name: Zombie Commander
Zombie Commander.description: Mumkuh can use Command Zombie on up to 16 zombies at once, enough to control an entire shambler troop.

Create Zombies.name: Create Zombies
Create Zombies.description: A zombie lord can create lesser zombies with a 1-hour ritual. During this time, the zombie lord chants and performs an unholy dance over the corpses they intend to animate. Unlike normal rituals, this doesn't require a skill check or cost. At the end of this hour, the zombie lord can create one 1st- or 2nd-level zombie, or two zombies of level 0 or lower. These are automatically under the zombie lord's control and count toward the limit of Command Zombie. Any zombies created by the zombie lord still count toward the XP budget of an encounter normally.

Command Zombie.name: Command Zombie
Command Zombie.description:
The zombie lord intones blasphemous words to gain control over a zombie they can see within 100 feet. A zombie that is mindless and not under someone else's control falls under their control automatically; otherwise, the zombie or its controller can attempt a @Check[will|dc:22] save to avoid it being controlled (whichever has the higher modifier). The target zombie is temporarily immune for 24 hours if successful. The attempt fails if the zombie is the same level as the zombie lord or higher

The zombie remains controlled by the zombie lord until either is destroyed. A zombie lord can control up to 8 zombies at a time. If the zombie lord would control a number of zombies over this limit, they choose which to release.

Unkillable.name: Unkillable
Unkillable.description: Mumkuh is nigh unkillable. She loses her weakness to slashing and gains resistance 3 against all damage, and she gains weakness 6 to critical hits.

Mumkuh.publicNotes:
Cunning zombie lords command their lesser kin, which they can use in unexpected ways. They have been known to direct or collaborate with husk and withered zombies, creating cells of intelligent zombies hiding within the ranks of mindless undead.

Simple to create and varied in purpose, these shambling undead are often used for their strength and endless stamina to conduct boring, repetitive tasks.

Larval Cave Worm Brood (Rock).publicNotes:
While gestating, cave worms adapt to their surrounding environments, becoming accustomed to extreme temperatures and hazards nearby. For example, cave worms hatched in volcanic environments mature into crimson worms, while those raised near water sources mature into azure worms. Regardless of their environment, larval cave worms all have translucent bodies and pallid carapaces that harden and change color as they mature. When a brood of cave worms hatches from their eggs, the foot-long worms mass together, forming a swarm of ravenous larval worms. This swarm travels ceaselessly, consuming anything in its path. The young are drawn to movement, as living, squirming prey tends to be the most nutritious. As they age, they incorporate more minerals into their diet to support carapace growth.

Cave worms are gigantic scavengers who shape their environment as they bore through rock, ice, or other substances on their search for food. These behemoths consume everything in their path. Though they usually prefer soil, minerals, and occasionally constructed buildings, they will also eat living creatures, plants, and other organic materials. There are numerous species of cave worms, each a different color and perfectly adapted to their surrounding environment. Cave worms rarely exceed a typical animal's intelligence. They're also poor parents that lay a clutch of eggs sealed in a protein shell before abandoning them. After a short incubation period, the young hatch, forming a swarming mass of ravenous larval cave worms. When nearing maturity or when starved of sufficiently rich soil, these larval worms turn on one another. They fight for dominance or flee until only a few remain. The survivors grow quickly, rapidly becoming juvenile cave worms.

Brood Variance

The cave worms presented here are typical of standard rock worms. For crimson worms, use the elite adjustment and add immunity to fire. For azure worms, increase their swim Speed to 40. Gray worms gain void healing and a weakness to vitality energy 5. Glacial worms gain immunity to cold.

Early Hatchling

A single cave worm egg can produce several thousand larval cave worms when it slowly matures over a millennia. However, if a cave worm egg is disturbed or damaged before its natural cycle completes, the egg enters a rapid stage of maturation. Only a few hundred worms survive this process, creating significantly fewer offspring than when allowed to mature slowly.

Ferocious Gnaw.name: Ferocious Gnaw
Ferocious Gnaw.description: Each foe in the larval swarm's space takes @Damage[(6d6)[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save).

Pummeling Thrash.name: Pummeling Thrash
Pummeling Thrash.description:
Requirements The larval swarm's most recent action was Ferocious Gnaw

Effect The larval swarm frantically thrashes in an effort to consume its prey. The larval swarm attempts an @Check[athletics|defense:reflex] check and compares the result to the Reflex DC of each creature in its space.

Critical Success The creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and take @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

Success The creature falls prone and takes @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

Relentless.name: Relentless
Relentless.description: When a juvenile cave worm gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} condition, reduce the duration by half, to a minimum of 1 round. It also recovers from penalties to its Speeds and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition at the end of its turn. Finally, it ignores non-magical difficult terrain and treats greater difficult terrain like difficult terrain.

Shake It Off.name: Shake It Off
Shake It Off.description:
Trigger The larval cave worm brood would be affected by a condition or adverse effect (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dN8QBNuTiaBHCKUe]{Cursed Metamorphosis})

Effect The larval brood negates the triggering condition or effect. Effects from artifacts, deities, or a similarly powerful source can't be avoided in this way.

Larval Cave Worm Brood (Rock).name: Larval Cave Worm Brood (Rock)

Thrash.description: The crimson worm statue makes a Strike against each creature in its reach. It can strike up to once with its jaws and any number of times with its tail. Each attack counts toward the worm's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all its attacks.
Thrash.name: Thrash

Vomit Worms.name: Vomit Worms
Vomit Worms.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The statue disgorges a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-3.Actor.aQusm2Uh1tw00IVb]{Bore Worm Swarm} into an adjacent 10-foot-by-10-foot space. Creatures in the swarm's area are immediately affected by the bore worm swarm's Swarming Bites, after which the bore worm swarm rolls initiative and acts independently before disappearing after [[/gmr 1d6 #Minutes]]{1d6 minutes}.

Construct Armor.name: Construct Armor
Construct Armor.description: Like normal objects, a crimson worm statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once a crimson worm statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 22.

Spitter Pods.name: 吐毒孢囊 Spitter Pods
Spitter Pods.disable: @Check[crafting|dc:18]来向真菌的储存罐中添加破坏性的化学制剂，@Check[nature|dc:18]（受训）来识别如何限制化学制剂的流动，或者@Check[deception|dc:20]（受训）来散布能扰乱真菌的孢子；需要合计3次成功才能解除陷阱。
Spitter Pods.hazarddescription: 特殊的孢子囊，能排出毒液球并从炼金储存罐中补充毒液。
Spitter Pods.routine: （3个动作）吐毒孢囊交替进行作出打击和装填动作。每个成功的解除陷阱检定都会使得吐毒孢囊失去1个动作。

Unfurl.name: 展开 Unfurl
Unfurl.description:
触发 非真菌生物进入区域E4

效果 吐毒孢囊投掷先攻。

Enraged Dream.name: Enraged Dream
Enraged Dream.publicNotes:
An animate dream coalesces from centuries of stray fragments of reverie and dream left behind as slumbering minds drift through the Dimension of Dreams. In most cases, these fragments simply disperse on their own, but when dreamers flee from nightmares back to the waking world, these fragments can take on a supernatural life of their own. They have little reasoning and intent except to seek similar fragments, absorb them, and grow. When enough of them gather together, they merge into a horrific form as an animate dream.

Individually, animate dreams can hold a wide range of appearances, but most take on rudimentary shapes akin to the living forms of the minds that spawned them. Animate dreams that rise from slumbering humanoids, the most commonly encountered, thus appear humanoid, but with distorted, nightmarish shapes that incorporate additional twisted limbs and frightening features. In these forms, animate dreams find their way out of the Dreamlands and into the waking world, only to discover they have no way of returning and suffer a relentless hunger that only new nightmares can sate.

An animate dream thrives on the terror fueled by nightmares and fear and uses its supernatural abilities to invoke such feelings in the minds of its victims, cursing its prey by creating a permanent link to that individual's dreams. Thereafter, the victim is subjected to all manner of reoccurring nightmares. As the nightmares continue, the victim finds it more and more difficult to remain awake. In the end, the victim plunges into an accursed slumber from which it cannot return. These victims provide the animate dream with the purest form of fear and are its preferred sustenance.

An animate dream can subsist on the ambient fear generated by regular nightmares, but these lesser fears aren't as satisfying, often driving the animate dream to seek out new victims. Left without a source of fear, an animate dream won't starve to death, but it will grow increasingly violent and desperate. Famished animate dreams are the ones most often encountered, as they have been forced to abandon subtlety to pursue more blatant methods of harvesting fear. Yet such animate dreams also tend to be the least powerful of their kind. Those who have grown metaphysically fat on fear have generally done so by adopting a specific nightmare theme, such as being buried alive, being swept away by ocean waves, or being consumed by wild beasts. Such animate dreams often have similarly themed innate spells to augment their powers.
Enraged Dream.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Endless Nightmare.name: Endless Nightmare
Endless Nightmare.description:
An animate dream's touch fills the victim's mind with terrifying visions

Natural Glow.name: Natural Glow
Natural Glow.description: An ether sprite sheds light as a torch. The sprite can suppress this glow by spending a single action with the concentrate trait.

Ether Sprite.name: Ether Sprite
Ether Sprite.publicNotes:
Sprite

The fey of the Ether Court in the Darklands have evolved somewhat differently from the First World kin that exiled them, becoming more cruel and less mischievous than is typical for their kind.

Ether Sprite

The excitable sprites of the Ether Court prefer to frolic, drink, insult each other, and perform improv comedy.

Sprite Collections

Ether sprites have a reputation for being thieves. In truth, they're generally curious about the world and simply have a tendency to walk away with objects that don't belong to them, not understanding the concept of ownership. As a result, ether sprites tend to have small interesting objects in their possession, such as talismans or gemstones.

Xulgath Ravening.name: Xulgath Ravening

Stench.name: Stench
Stench.description:
30 feet. A creature that enters the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and on a critical failure, the creature also takes a –5 status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. While within the aura, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all xulgaths stenches for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.uB3CVn3momZO9h0L]{Effect: Xulgath Stench}

Frequency once per round

Effect The xulgath ravening lashes out at enemies within 5 feet (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage

2 @Damage[(1d6+5)[slashing]] damage

3 @Damage[(2d6+5)[slashing]] damage

Infected Wounds.name: Infected Wounds
Infected Wounds.description: The xulgaths' Fang and Claw deals an additional @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage to any creature sickened by a xulgath's stench.

Sharpened Advance.name: Sharpened Advance
Sharpened Advance.description: The troop fires a ranged attack in the form of a @Template[burst|distance:5] within 50 feet that deals @Damage[3d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect] save), then the troop either Steps or Strides up to 15 feet toward the area they attacked.

Troop Movement.description: Whenever a troop Strides, it first Forms Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by–20- foot area (minus any missing squares), then moves up to its Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square of the troop enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to the whole troop.

Xulgath Ravening.publicNotes:
Strength and hunger drive most xulgath societies, reinforced by the tenets of their abyssal patron Zevgavizeb. A powerful leader can seize control of a xulgath community and direct their followers to fight as a unit, but formation fighting isn't something most xulgaths practice. This mob mentality often results in overzealous warriors tripping over or even biting each other. Suitably, these mobs have earned the name "ravenings," a term also used when describing Zevgavizeb's carnivorous rampages and referring to the millennia of xulgath infighting and social decline.

The Power of Suggestion

Xulgath ravening are most common in clutches controlled by spiritual leaders using some combination of cult behavior, group ritual, and even a little enchantment magic. By convincing participants that they're possessed by Zevgavizeb or a similar force, the leader then identifies a target and hopes for the best. Instilling secular doubt or incapacitating the leader can shatter a ravening's focus, causing its members to scatter or even turn on their leader.

Psychic Daze.name: Psychic Daze
Psychic Daze.description:
The mindreaver targets one creature within 120 feet and violently intrudes into their mind. The target attempts a @Check[will|dc:22] save.

Critical Success The target creature is unaffected.

Success The target creature gains weakness 1 to mental damage for 1 minute. If they already have weakness to mental damage, the value of the weakness increases by one.

Failure The target creature takes 2d10 mental damage and gains weakness 1 to mental damage for 1 minute. If they already have weakness to mental damage, the value of the weakness increases by one.

Critical Failure As failure, except the target's weakness to mental damage increases by 2.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wEFRo8enunRLFsVE]{Effect: Psychic Daze}

Ulat-Kini Mindreaver.name: Ulat-Kini Mindreaver
Ulat-Kini Mindreaver.publicNotes:
When not being controlled and manipulated by alghollthus, ulat-kinis have found they can develop formidable psychic powers. Those who master this craft are dubbed "mindreavers" by their awestruck kin.

Ulat-Kini Culture

The creatures who surface humanoids consider scum still hold grand empires beneath the waves. While some ulat-kinis still revere the alghollthu who created them and others have learned to hate their creators, there are ulat-kinis who have found a new way forward. They have developed their own culture outside of alghollthu influence, founding new underwater traditions and creating new cultural standards.

Howl of Agony.name: Howl of Agony
Howl of Agony.description:
Trigger At least two living creatures step on the staircase

Effect Dozens of mouths open on the stairs and eastern wall doors of the chamber and howl in anger and misery. Creatures in the area are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 2 rounds and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} unless they succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:27] save. Creatures who critically fail are deafened for 1 minute and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}. The haunt then rolls initiative.

Angry Dead.name: Angry Dead
Angry Dead.disable: @Check[religion|dc:23] (trained) to ritually pray for the dead or @Check[occultism|dc:25] (trained) to exorcise the spirits' anger; a dwarf succeeds at a @Check[diplomacy|dc:22] or Intimidate check, asking or ordering the spirits to stand down.
Angry Dead.hazarddescription: The faces of the original dwarven inhabitants of the city appear in the stone and scream in anger.
Angry Dead.routine: (1 action) The faces continue to scream, dealing @Damage[5d6[sonic]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save) to all living creatures within 20 feet of the steps. On a critical failure, a creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 round. Deaf creatures are immune to this effect.
Angry Dead.reset: The haunt deactivates 1 round after all living creatures leave the area. After 1 hour, the haunt reactivates. If the haunt is disabled by a dwarf succeeding at a Diplomacy or Intimidate check, the haunt is destroyed.

Hryngar Breccia Squad.name: Hryngar Breccia Squad
Hryngar Breccia Squad.publicNotes:
A hryngar breccia squad is a group of hryngar martial combatants armed with melee weapons and steel shields. Though more likely to be encountered near large hryngar settlements, these strike forces see wide use throughout the Darklands. Hryngar breccia squads often serve as military units, mercenary companies, city patrols, and caravan guards. Like all warriors, the favored combat methods of a hryngar breccia squad change by location, often due to surrounding environment and popular equipment.

Deep under the surface of Golarion, dwarves still dwell in the darkness. Once abandoned by their kin who were obsessed with reaching the surface, these dwarves have found that by working harder than their brethren, they can build a society far greater than anything under the sun. Droskar, Master of the Dark Furnace, teaches them that toiling for their masters, who in turn toil for their masters above, will lead all of them to become stronger than ever. Every hryngar knows that their labor defines them, and brings them glory in the eyes of Droskar and their peers. Exhaustion at the end of the work day is an honor, proof of their worth in society.

Rift Jumpers

Hryngar breccia squads that specialize in spelunking are known as Rift Jumpers, named for their reckless leaps into perilous chasms. They swap their shields and warhammers for light picks and train with their climbing equipment until it serves as an extension of their body. Rift Jumpers lose the Raise Shields, Shield Block, and Push Back actions, and gain a climb Speed of 20 feet.

Skibrellon.publicNotes:
莱西有时会成为食草动物和其他觅食者的猎物。尽管它们中的大多数都能坦然面对这一事实，但真菌莱西们有时会为此感到愤怒并探寻真菌更加无情的一面：分解和占据。将缺乏道德的实验、改变意识的虫草菌、以及它们那受害者叙事所驱动的异能魔法结合在一起，真菌莱西能转化为菌丝暴君，它会将尸体转化为孢植傀儡来祸害当地的动物群。这些莱西最大的不幸可能就是它们自己那随时可能消逝的生命。随着菌丝暴君日复一日对腐朽的称颂，它们的怨恨与驱动的异能会缓慢耗竭自身的生命力，最终会在毁灭性能量的终幕爆发中消亡。

令人不安的转生 Troubled Reincarnation

通常来说，莱西的精魂会在死后在自然界中游荡，最终栖息到一具新的莱西身体中。目前尚不清楚菌丝暴君是否能够成为新的莱西。据推测，除非它们能够寻回自我或得到救赎，否则它们最终会在自然界中作祟并化身为恶鬼，或者甚至永远消逝。

Sporesense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: 孢子感知（模糊）60尺 Sporesense (Imprecise) 60 feet
Sporesense (Imprecise) 60 feet.description: 菌丝暴君能凭直觉感知并追踪所有附近的真菌。这种感官能辨别真菌生物、真菌构成的地貌或者真菌覆盖着的生物。

Spore Burst.description: 当菌丝暴君死亡时，一股原能能量从它体内迸发出来影响@Template[emanation|distance:30]区域，为区域内的每个真菌生物恢复3d8点并对每个非真菌生物造成@Damage[3d8[void]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[fortitude|dc:20|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。该区域会遍布真菌，成为困难地形。

Relentless.description: When a juvenile cave worm gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} condition, reduce the duration by half, to a minimum of 1 round. It also recovers from penalties to its Speeds and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition at the end of its turn. Finally, it ignores non-magical difficult terrain and treats greater difficult terrain like difficult terrain.
