Rowdy Clamor.name: Rowdy Clamor
Rowdy Clamor.description: 20 feet. The sprite swarm creates a din by laughing, taunting, and insulting nearby creatures. Creatures in the area are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}.

Natural Glow.name: Natural Glow
Natural Glow.description: An ether sprite sheds light as a torch. The sprite can suppress this glow by spending a single action with the concentrate trait.

Luminous Pattern.name: Luminous Pattern
Luminous Pattern.description: The sprites glow brightly, flying in a shifting pattern of light. All creatures within 20 feet become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 minute (@Check[will|dc:16] negates).

Spark Bombardment.name: Spark Bombardment
Spark Bombardment.description: The sprites hurl luminous sparks at a creature within 20 feet dealing @Damage[5d4[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save).

Swarm Steal.name: Swarm Steal
Swarm Steal.description: The sprites rummage through the possessions of a single creature within its space, attempting a @Check[thievery|defense:reflex] check against the creature's Reflex DC. On a success, the sprites take one item of negligible or light bulk that the creature is carrying but not holding or readied. On a critical success, the item can be one that is held or readied, such as a weapon or potion

Swarming Needles.name: Swarming Needles
Swarming Needles.description: The sprites numerous rapiers deal @Damage[2d6[piercing]] damage to each enemy in the swarm's space (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save).

Ether Sprite Swarm.name: Ether Sprite Swarm
Ether Sprite Swarm.publicNotes:
One ether sprite is quite enough for most, and can be tiresome for even the fey. When a group of them get together, it's outright bedlam.

The fey of the Ether Court in the Darklands have evolved somewhat differently from the First World kin that exiled them, becoming more cruel and less mischievous than is typical for their kind.

Sprite Collections

Ether sprites have a reputation for being thieves. In truth, they're generally curious about the world and simply have a tendency to walk away with objects that don't belong to them, not understanding the concept of ownership. As a result, ether sprites tend to have small interesting objects in their possession, such as talismans or gemstones.

Brutal Rally.description:
Trigger The gang leader rolls a critical hit against a creature

Effect All allies that can see the gang leader gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls until the start of the gang leader's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.7x0O2GqWBJiAk5PF]{Effect: Brutal Rally}
Brutal Rally.name: Brutal Rally

Deny Advantage.name: Deny Advantage
Deny Advantage.description: The gang leader isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures of 7th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking, or using surprise attack.

Evasion.name: Evasion
Evasion.description: When the gang leader rolls a success on a Reflex save, they get a critical success instead.

Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger The gang leader is targeted with an attack by an attacker they can see

Effect The gang leader gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, if the gang leader rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures who haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the gang leader.

Gang Up.name: Gang Up
Gang Up.description: Any enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the gang leader's melee attacks due to flanking as long as the enemy is within melee reach of both the gang leader and one of the gang leader's allies.

Quick Draw.name: Quick Draw
Quick Draw.description: The gang leader @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interacts} to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The gang leader deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Hryngar Veteran.name: Hryngar Veteran
Hryngar Veteran.publicNotes:
Cutthroats, killers, thieves, and toughs prey upon the vulnerable of society. Directing their activities and keeping them in line are the duties of the gang leader.

Villains pursue selfish and cruel goals, trampling over anyone foolish or purehearted enough to stand in their way.

Zivzeb.name: Zivzeb

Adhesive.name: Adhesive
Adhesive.description:
The mimic is coated in an adhesive slime. Any creature that hits the mimic, is hit by the mimic, or otherwise touches the mimic must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:23] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} ([[/act escape dc=23]]). A weapon that hits the mimic is stuck to the mimic and can be removed with a successful @Check[athletics|dc:23] check (made as a single action).

A mimic can have any number of objects or creatures stuck to it at a time. The mimic can release a stuck creature or object by using a single action, and the adhesive dissolves 1 minute after the mimic dies, releasing all stuck objects and creatures.

Mimic Object.description: The mimic assumes the shape of any Medium object. This doesn't change the mimic's texture or overall size but can alter its coloration and visual appearance. It has an automatic result of 28 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as the object that it's mimicking.
Mimic Object.name: Mimic Object

Object Lesson.name: Object Lesson
Object Lesson.description:
Trigger A creature touches or physically interacts with the mimic while the mimic is transformed using Mimic Object.

Effect The triggering creature is automatically stuck by the mimic's adhesive (it receives no save). The mimic then makes a pseudopod Strike against any creature adjacent to the mimic.

Object Lesson can't be used again until the mimic escapes and takes on a new disguise.

Zivzeb.publicNotes:
Thought to be the result of a failed experiment meant to animate objects or a sinister alghollthu creation, mimics are clever monsters that can take the form of common manufactured objects. Mimics are ambush predators and voracious eaters, surprising their prey through their uncanny ability to mimic the form of common furniture and miscellany. They remain disguised until unsuspecting adventurers happen by, then they lash out in ambush.

Mimics possess complex alien minds, and while often cruel and self-serving, they also enjoy conversation with their prey from time to time. For unknown reasons, they are especially interested in humanoids. Mimics have a strong dislike for others of their kind and tend to live alone. A mimic can remain in its alternate form for an extremely long period of time, sometimes remaining disguised in a dungeon chamber for decades. Regardless of how long it waits, the mimic remains vigilant and alert, ready to strike at any moment.

Heartbroken Dream.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
Heartbroken Dream.name: Heartbroken Dream
Heartbroken Dream.publicNotes:
An animate dream coalesces from centuries of stray fragments of reverie and dream left behind as slumbering minds drift through the Dimension of Dreams. In most cases, these fragments simply disperse on their own, but when dreamers flee from nightmares back to the waking world, these fragments can take on a supernatural life of their own. They have little reasoning and intent except to seek similar fragments, absorb them, and grow. When enough of them gather together, they merge into a horrific form as an animate dream.

Individually, animate dreams can hold a wide range of appearances, but most take on rudimentary shapes akin to the living forms of the minds that spawned them. Animate dreams that rise from slumbering humanoids, the most commonly encountered, thus appear humanoid, but with distorted, nightmarish shapes that incorporate additional twisted limbs and frightening features. In these forms, animate dreams find their way out of the Dreamlands and into the waking world, only to discover they have no way of returning and suffer a relentless hunger that only new nightmares can sate.

An animate dream thrives on the terror fueled by nightmares and fear and uses its supernatural abilities to invoke such feelings in the minds of its victims, cursing its prey by creating a permanent link to that individual's dreams. Thereafter, the victim is subjected to all manner of reoccurring nightmares. As the nightmares continue, the victim finds it more and more difficult to remain awake. In the end, the victim plunges into an accursed slumber from which it cannot return. These victims provide the animate dream with the purest form of fear and are its preferred sustenance.

An animate dream can subsist on the ambient fear generated by regular nightmares, but these lesser fears aren't as satisfying, often driving the animate dream to seek out new victims. Left without a source of fear, an animate dream won't starve to death, but it will grow increasingly violent and desperate. Famished animate dreams are the ones most often encountered, as they have been forced to abandon subtlety to pursue more blatant methods of harvesting fear. Yet such animate dreams also tend to be the least powerful of their kind. Those who have grown metaphysically fat on fear have generally done so by adopting a specific nightmare theme, such as being buried alive, being swept away by ocean waves, or being consumed by wild beasts. Such animate dreams often have similarly themed innate spells to augment their powers.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Endless Nightmare.name: Endless Nightmare
Endless Nightmare.description:
An animate dream's touch fills the victim's mind with terrifying visions

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:26]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

Stage 2 fatigued and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 The victim falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} and can't be awakened as long as they remain at this stage (1 day).

Tethered Soul.name: Tethered Soul
Tethered Soul.description: The soul focus gem that powers a soulbound mauler is tethered with eight ectoplasmic leashes inside an open cavity in the creature's chest. It can be targeted directly with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} action. Rather than the normal result of these actions, the soulbound mauler takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} on a success; on a critical success, it takes @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Eager Rend.name: Eager Rend
Eager Rend.description:
The soulbound mauler has a living creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

Effect The soulbound mauler holds the creature it has grabbed and attempts to tear it in two. That creature takes @Damage[5d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:18|basic]). On a critical failure, the target also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

Personality Cage.name: Personality Cage
Personality Cage.description: A soulbound mauler encapsulates an entire soul within its soul focus gem, with that soul's personality and past shining through along with a confusing mix of fragmented memories and instincts. This causes a soulbound mauler to match the donor soul's alignment and gain the corresponding alignment traits. When the mauler doesn't have a soul bound, it's inanimate.

Soulbound Mauler (Lawful Neutral).name: Soulbound Mauler (Lawful Neutral)
Soulbound Mauler (Lawful Neutral).publicNotes:
If a soulbound doll isn't large and strong enough for one's needs, there's the oversized soulbound mauler. An upgrade to the soulbound doll, this mannequin is powered by the entire soul of a sapient creature. Many a necromancer has attempted to use these constructs as a method to live forever, likely as a shortcut around the complicated and ultimately morbid path to lichdom. However, the soul within the mannequin has problems properly expressing itself and displays rudimentary control over the host, often resulting in childlike behavior anywhere from curious to sadistic.

Rather than embedding the soul focus gem in the construct's neck or chest, it's tethered by bands of ectoplasm within an exposed chamber on the mannequin's chest. Until the soulbound mauler is destroyed, the focus gem cannot be removed from the empty cavity in its chest. However, the gem can be displaced which causes the soulbound mauler significant anguish, not only damaging the connection between the gem and artificial body, but also impairing the construct's ability to function.

Innate Spells

Like a soulbound doll, a soulbound mauler gains an additional 3rd-rank innate spell depending on its alignment, as listed below.

Lawful Good: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal}

Neutral Good: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Q7QQ91vQtyi1Ux36]{Jump}

Chaotic Good: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o6YCGx4lycsYpww4]{Haste}

Lawful Neutral: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VosLNn2M8S7JH67D]{Blindness}

Neutral: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.I0j56TNRmGcTyoqJ]{Shared Invisibility}

Chaotic Neutral: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter}

Lawful Evil: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WsUwpfmhKrKwoIe3]{Slow}

Neutral Evil: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GKpEcy9WId6NJvtx]{Stinking Cloud}

Chaotic Evil: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm}

Blue Flames.name: Blue Flames
Blue Flames.description: When the elemental inferno scores a critical hit, its body surges with blue flames, increasing the damage of its intense heat and Inferno Leap by @Damage[3d6[fire]]{3d6} until the start of its next turn.

Inferno Leap.name: Inferno Leap
Inferno Leap.description:
The elemental inferno jumps horizontally and vertically with a maximum height and distance each equal to its Speed. Its intense heat is suppressed until the end of the jump. At any point during the jump, flames explode from the elemental in a @Template[emanation|distance:20], dealing @Damage[12d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The elemental inferno can't Inferno Leap again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Inferno Leap]]{1d4 rounds}.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: The elemental inferno ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Explosion.name: Explosion
Explosion.description: When the elemental inferno dies, it explodes, dealing @Damage[7d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:10|traits:fire,damaging-effect] (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect] save).

Flames of Taargick.name: Flames of Taargick
Flames of Taargick.publicNotes:
Walking conflagrations of unimaginably hot fire, elemental infernos are harbingers of destruction and heedless chaos.

Fire elementals are destructive manifestations of the scorching Plane of Fire.

Larval Cave Worm Brood (Azure).name: Larval Cave Worm Brood (Azure)

Shake It Off.name: Shake It Off
Shake It Off.description:
Trigger The larval cave worm brood would be affected by a condition or adverse effect (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dN8QBNuTiaBHCKUe]{Cursed Metamorphosis})

Effect The larval brood negates the triggering condition or effect. Effects from artifacts, deities, or a similarly powerful source can't be avoided in this way.

Ferocious Gnaw.name: Ferocious Gnaw
Ferocious Gnaw.description: Each foe in the larval swarm's space takes @Damage[(6d6)[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save).

Pummeling Thrash.name: Pummeling Thrash
Pummeling Thrash.description:
Requirements The larval swarm's most recent action was Ferocious Gnaw

Effect The larval swarm frantically thrashes in an effort to consume its prey. The larval swarm attempts an @Check[athletics|defense:reflex] check and compares the result to the Reflex DC of each creature in its space.

Critical Success The creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and take @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

Success The creature falls prone and takes @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

Relentless.name: Relentless
Relentless.description: When a juvenile cave worm gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} condition, reduce the duration by half, to a minimum of 1 round. It also recovers from penalties to its Speeds and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition at the end of its turn. Finally, it ignores non-magical difficult terrain and treats greater difficult terrain like difficult terrain.

Larval Cave Worm Brood (Azure).publicNotes:
While gestating, cave worms adapt to their surrounding environments, becoming accustomed to extreme temperatures and hazards nearby. For example, cave worms hatched in volcanic environments mature into crimson worms, while those raised near water sources mature into azure worms. Regardless of their environment, larval cave worms all have translucent bodies and pallid carapaces that harden and change color as they mature. When a brood of cave worms hatches from their eggs, the foot-long worms mass together, forming a swarm of ravenous larval worms. This swarm travels ceaselessly, consuming anything in its path. The young are drawn to movement, as living, squirming prey tends to be the most nutritious. As they age, they incorporate more minerals into their diet to support carapace growth.

Cave worms are gigantic scavengers who shape their environment as they bore through rock, ice, or other substances on their search for food. These behemoths consume everything in their path. Though they usually prefer soil, minerals, and occasionally constructed buildings, they will also eat living creatures, plants, and other organic materials. There are numerous species of cave worms, each a different color and perfectly adapted to their surrounding environment. Cave worms rarely exceed a typical animal's intelligence. They're also poor parents that lay a clutch of eggs sealed in a protein shell before abandoning them. After a short incubation period, the young hatch, forming a swarming mass of ravenous larval cave worms. When nearing maturity or when starved of sufficiently rich soil, these larval worms turn on one another. They fight for dominance or flee until only a few remain. The survivors grow quickly, rapidly becoming juvenile cave worms.

Brood Variance

The cave worms presented here are typical of standard rock worms. For crimson worms, use the elite adjustment and add immunity to fire. For azure worms, increase their swim Speed to 40. Gray worms gain void healing and a weakness to vitality energy 5. Glacial worms gain immunity to cold.

Early Hatchling

A single cave worm egg can produce several thousand larval cave worms when it slowly matures over a millennia. However, if a cave worm egg is disturbed or damaged before its natural cycle completes, the egg enters a rapid stage of maturation. Only a few hundred worms survive this process, creating significantly fewer offspring than when allowed to mature slowly.

Heldin Ulgincamp.name: 海尔丁·厄艮坎普 Heldin Ulgincamp

Anchor the Unliving.name: 锚定死者 Anchor the Unliving
Anchor the Unliving.description:
海尔丁向30尺内的1个不死生物展示它圣徽。该生物必须尝试@Check[fortitude|dc:17]豁免。

大成功 该生物不受影响

成功 让生物的抗力降低1点，持续[[/r 1d4]]轮，在此之后它会在1轮内免疫该能力

失败 同成功，但是抗力降低3点

大失败 同成功，但是抗力降低5点

Toil is Strength.name: Toil is Strength
Toil is Strength.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet would succeed at a save against a spell or ability that causes the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition

Effect The target must reroll the triggering saving throw and use the worse result.

Hammerfall.name: Hammerfall
Hammerfall.description: The forgepriest tosses their hammer up to 30 feet. Where the hammer lands, molten metal erupts from the ground in a @Template[burst|distance:10]{10 foot radius} dealing @Damage[6d8[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures who critically fail also take @Damage[1d8[persistent,fire]] damage. The forgepriest can't use Hammerfall again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hammerfall]]{1d4 rounds}.

Hryngar Forgepriest.name: Hryngar Forgepriest
Hryngar Forgepriest.publicNotes:
Abandoned by their cousins, the surface dwarves, hryngars were saved by Droskar, who taught them to work hard and give no quarter. Now, that hardness is the sword and shield by which the hryngar rule their kingdoms. The forgepriests proselytize Droskar's teachings and punish heretics for any defiance.

Hryngars descend from dwarves who did not undertake the Quest for Sky and remained denizens of the Darklands. Most now worship Droskar, god of toil.

Upworlder Prejudice

Many upworlders' only experience with denizens from the Darklands come from Darklands raids. This has unfortunately caused many on the surface to believe that all Darklands peoples are murderous, which, of course, isn't the case. The Darklands are a harsh realm, and the people who live there have adapted to survive in an unforgiving environment that rewards the strong and punishes the meek. Yet despite this, there are still rich cultures and compassionate beings below the surface of Golarion.

Highhelm Propaganda

Upworlders often believe that hryngars make shoddy weapons and armor, but this is propaganda spread by dwarves on the surface. Any proud hryngar knows that if you work hard enough on a project, it will come out just as well as crafters who rely on clever secrets and modern techniques. Therefore hryngar-made products often have fewer aesthetic elements in their design. Their creations tend to focus more on pure function.

Buried Shock Glyph.hazarddescription: 被触动时会放出一道电能冲击的魔法刻文

Electrocution.name: 触电 Electrocution
Electrocution.description:
触发 有生物推挤或查看刻文

效果 释放出的电流会电击触发生物和10尺内的所有生物，对区域内的任何人造成@Damage[3d8[electricity]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic]豁免）。

Buried Shock Glyph.name: 被掩埋的电击刻文 Buried Shock Glyph
Buried Shock Glyph.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:20]（受训）来在石板被激活前将其投掷到安全的距离外，或者@Check[thievery|dc:21]来在不触发刻文的情况下小心翼翼地挪开石板。

Relentless.name: Relentless
Relentless.description: When a juvenile cave worm gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} condition, reduce the duration by half, to a minimum of 1 round. It also recovers from penalties to its Speeds and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition at the end of its turn. Finally, it ignores non-magical difficult terrain and treats greater difficult terrain like difficult terrain.

Effect The larval brood negates the triggering condition or effect. Effects from artifacts, deities, or a similarly powerful source can't be avoided in this way.

Ferocious Gnaw.description: Each foe in the larval swarm's space takes @Damage[(6d6)[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save).

Pummeling Thrash.name: Pummeling Thrash
Pummeling Thrash.description:
Requirements The larval swarm's most recent action was Ferocious Gnaw

Effect The larval swarm frantically thrashes in an effort to consume its prey. The larval swarm attempts an @Check[athletics|defense:reflex] check and compares the result to the Reflex DC of each creature in its space.

Critical Success The creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and take @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

Success The creature falls prone and takes @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

Larval Cave Worm Brood (Crimson).publicNotes:

Spore Explosion.name: 孢子爆炸 Spore Explosion
Spore Explosion.description: 在被摧毁时，孢植头颅会产生由骨片和有毒孢子构成的爆炸，对每个相邻的生物造成@Damage[1d6[piercing],1d6[poison]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic]豁免）。

Stir the Spores.name: 搅动孢子 Stir the Spores
Stir the Spores.description:
频率 每[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Stir the Spores]]{1d4轮}一次

触发 孢植头颅承受钝击、穿刺或挥砍伤害

效果 冲击会将孢子散布至5尺射程内的所有生物身上，使它们陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}（@Check[fortitude|dc:18]豁免，通过则无效）。

Sporeborn Skull.name: 孢植头颅 Sporeborn Skull
Sporeborn Skull.publicNotes:
远比普通的活化头颅更危险，这些颅骨被诡异的火焰所包裹。

活化头颅由被斩首之人的头复活而来。这些无心智的不死生物或飞在空中或翻滚着攻击它们的猎物。

Shake It Off.name: Shake It Off
Shake It Off.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Narseigus fails or critically fails a saving throw against a condition or adverse effect (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dN8QBNuTiaBHCKUe]{Cursed Metamorphosis})

Effect Narseigus rerolls the triggering saving throw and uses the better result.

Quickened Casting.name: Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description: If Narseigus' next action is to cast an occult spontaneous cantrip or an occult spontaneous spell of 4th level or lower, he reduces the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt Narseigus' spellcasting action, he attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Inexorable.name: Inexorable
Inexorable.description: When Narseigus gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} condition, roll a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, he ignores the condition.

Worm Form.name: Worm Form
Worm Form.description: Narseigus partially transforms his lower body into that of a cave worm. He can use only his tail unarmed Strike and his burrow and climb Speeds while in this form. This transformation lasts for 1 minute.

Worm's Feast.name: Worm's Feast
Worm's Feast.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Narseigus calls forth a brood of infantile cave worms to feast on his enemy's flesh. One creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:27] save.

Critical Success The worms writhe away harmlessly.

Success The target takes @Damage[2d6[piercing],4d6[persistent,piercing]]{2d6 piercing damage and 4d6 persistent piercing} damage.

Failure The target takes @Damage[6d6[piercing],4d6[persistent,piercing]]{6d6 piercing damage and 4d6 persistent piercing} damage.

Critical Failure As failure, plus the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} as long as it takes persistent piercing damage.

Note: A DC for this ability was not provided by Paizo. The DC present here is a moderate DC for the creature's level based on the Gamemastery Guide creature building rules

Narseigus Wormcaller.name: Narseigus Wormcaller
Narseigus Wormcaller.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

Blood-Crazed.name: Blood-Crazed
Blood-Crazed.description: If the bloodseeker starts its turn within 60 feet of a creature with bleed damage, it must attempt a @Check[flat|dc:11]. On a failure, the bloodseeker attempts to move adjacent to the bleeding creature and Strike it with its proboscis. The bloodseeker gains a +4 circumstance bonus to attack rolls against this target.

Blood Drain.name: Blood Drain
Blood Drain.description:
Requirements The bloodseeker's last action was a successful Strike with its proboscis against a target with blood

Effect The bloodseeker sucks blood from that target, dealing @Damage[2d4] damage, and the bloodseeker gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Giant Bloodseeker.name: Giant Bloodseeker
Giant Bloodseeker.publicNotes:
The Court of Ether breeds bloodseekers to enormous sizes to serve as cavalry mounts for their non-winged warriors. These bloodseekers serve as capable mounts—at least until they detect the scent of blood.

Decades ago, the Court of Ether bred bloodseekers as show animals, thinking them adorably ugly. Generations later, the insects have become giantic. Visitors to the Court are impressed by how the bloodseekers to hover in place, fly through hoops, and only drink the blood of specific creatures.

Bloodseeker Breeds

While the giant bloodseeker has the most notoriety for its size and use as a cavalry mount, other breeds have been created by determined ranchers. These including the longhaired bloodseeker, bloodseeker retriever, and the difficult-tocontain burrowing bloodseeker. Each of these recognized breeds can be submitted to the annual Court of Ether Bloodseeker Show, where breeders enter their prized, expensive, and well-trained bloodseekers in hopes of gaining the elusive "Best in Show" award.

Spore Burst.name: Spore Burst
Spore Burst.description: When a hyphae tyrant dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from its body in a @Template[emanation|distance:30], restoring 3d8 to each fungus creature and dealing @Damage[3d8[void]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:20|basic|options:area-effect] save) to each non-fungus creature in the area. This area is filled with fungus, becoming difficult terrain.

Spores.name: Spores
Spores.description: A creature that takes damage from a hyphae tyrant's spore pod Strike must attempt a saving throw with the same DC and effect as its Spore Cloud ability.

Sporesense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: Sporesense (Imprecise) 60 feet
Sporesense (Imprecise) 60 feet.description: A hyphae tyrant intuitively senses and tracks all nearby fungi. The sense can distinguish between fungus creatures, features made of fungus, and creatures covered in spores.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The hyphae tyrant transforms into a Small fungus. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{One with Plants}.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Spore Cloud.name: Spore Cloud
Spore Cloud.description: A hyphae tyrant unleashes a cloud of spores in a @Template[emanation|distance:20]. Each non-fungi creature in this area must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or take @Damage[2[persistent,poison]] damage. A creature has its vision reduced as long as the persistent damage continues and can see only within 20 feet (or 10 feet on a critical failure).

Hyphae Tyrant.name: Hyphae Tyrant
Hyphae Tyrant.publicNotes:
Leshy creations sometimes fall prey to herbivores and foragers. Whereas most take the loss in stride, fungus leshies sometimes grow bitter and explore the grimmer elements of fungi: decomposition and possession. Combining unethical experiments, mind-altering cordyceps spores, and occult magic fueled by their own victim narrative, a fungus leshy can transform into a hyphae tyrant, who in turn transforms corpses into sporeborn puppets to torment local fauna. These leshies' greatest tragedy is perhaps their own impermanence. As their agendas increasingly celebrate decay, a hyphae tyrant's spite and occult narrative slowly drain their life force, ultimately ending in a final burst of destructive energy.

Troubled Reincarnation

Typically, a leshy's spirit wanders the natural world after death, eventually inhabiting a new leshy body. It's unclear whether a hyphae tyrant's spirit can ever become a new leshy. It's speculated that they eventually become natural haunts, transform into oni, or even fade forever unless found and redeemed.

Ferret Fear.description: Stonemaker has an instinctive fear of mustelids like weasels, ferrets, and even pyre ferrets. He responds to such creatures as though they had @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.etMnv73EIdEZrYYu]{Frightful Presence} (@Check[will|dc:20|traits:emotion,fear,mental,action:frightful-presence]).
Ferret Fear.name: Ferret Fear

+2 Status to Saves Vs. Xulgath Stench.name: +2 Status to Saves Vs. Xulgath Stench

Petrifying Glance.description:
30 feet. Trigger A creature within 30 feet that the basilisk can see starts its turn.

Effect The target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save. If it fails, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute as its body slowly stiffens.
Petrifying Glance.name: Petrifying Glance

Petrifying Gaze.name: Petrifying Gaze
Petrifying Gaze.description:
The basilisk stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. That creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save. If it fails and has not already been slowed by Petrifying Glance or this ability, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. If the creature was already slowed by this ability or Petrifying Glance, a failed save causes the creature to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} permanently.

A creature petrified in this manner that is coated (not just splashed) with fresh basilisk blood (taken from a basilisk that has been dead no longer than 1 hour) is instantly restored to flesh.

A single basilisk contains enough blood to coat [[/br 1d3 #Medium Creatures]]{1d3 Medium creatures} in this manner.

Stonemaker.name: Stonemaker
Stonemaker.allSaves: +2 status to saves vs. xulgath stench
Stonemaker.publicNotes:
The basilisk is an eight-legged reptile with a nasty disposition and the ability to turn creatures to stone with its gaze. Folklore holds that, much like for the cockatrice, the first basilisks hatched from leathery eggs laid by snakes and incubated by roosters, but little in the basilisk's physiology lends any credence to this claim.

A basilisk prefers to eat petrified flesh. Once a victim has been turned to stone, the basilisk crunches the fossilized corpse with its powerful jaws and lets its potent stomach acids do the rest. This digestive process is extremely slow and inefficient, causing the basilisk to move so lethargically that it appears as if in mid-petrification itself. This has even led to the saying "as slow as a well-fed basilisk." Certainly basilisks are well-known for their slow gait and slothful nature, but a predator that can turn its prey to stone with a glance hardly has much need for speed.

An adult basilisk is 13 feet long from head to tail and weighs roughly 300 pounds. These reptiles make hissing sounds when moving about that turns to a guttural gurgle when they're agitated. Though they are normally solitary creatures that come together only to mate and lay eggs, there are periodic reports of regions being infested with unusual numbers of basilisks. What causes these unusual congregations of basilisk activity is unknown.

For unknown reasons, weasels and ferrets are immune to the basilisk's stare, and they sometimes sneak into basilisk lairs while a parent is hunting in order to consume eggs or freshly hatched young. Some legends suggest that a basilisk's blood can transmute common stones into other material, but this is likely a case of witnesses misinterpreting the magical restoration of previously petrified creatures or body parts.

Rolling Stone Cylinder Trap.name: Rolling Stone Cylinder Trap
Rolling Stone Cylinder Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:25] check to create a wedge to immobilize the column, @Check[athletics|dc:21] check to immobilize the column until the end of the creature's next turn, a creature can Climb over an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} column with a successful @Check[athletics|dc:18] check.
Rolling Stone Cylinder Trap.hazarddescription: A 10-foot-long, 5-foot-thick column of stone thuds to the ground, just in front of the bridge. It immediately starts to roll down the bridge, quickly picking up speed.
Rolling Stone Cylinder Trap.routine: (1 action) The rolling stone cylinder trap uses Crushing Roll.

Crushing Roll.name: Crushing Roll
Crushing Roll.description:
Requirements The rolling stone cylinder is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}

Effect The rolling stone cylinder trap moves its Speed west along the bridge. Creatures it moves past or lands on take @Damage[5d6[bludgeoning]] damage and are forced to move west to the first available space (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic]). Creatures who critically succeed at the Reflex save are not damaged but are still moved west. If the rolling stone tries to move into a non-creature obstruction, such as a wall or barricade, it deals bludgeoning damage to the obstruction and only continues moving if the obstruction is destroyed, otherwise the trap stops.

Drop and Roll.name: Drop and Roll
Drop and Roll.description:
A lever at the top of the south tower is pulled

Effect A thick column of stone drops from above the gate, then uses crushing roll. The rolling stone cylinder trap rolls initiative.

Bravery.name: Bravery
Bravery.description: When the Hrungul rolls a success on a Will save against a fear effect, he gets a critical success instead. In addition, any time he gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition, reduce its value by 1.

Double Slice.name: Double Slice
Double Slice.description: Hrungul makes a longsword Strike, followed by a shield boss Strike against the same target at a –2 penalty, each using his current multiple attack penalty. If both attacks hit, he combines their damage and applies resistances and weaknesses only once. This counts as two attacks when calculating his multiple attack penalty.

Grim Efficiency.name: Grim Efficiency
Grim Efficiency.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger A foe within 30 feet critically fails a Strike against Hrungul or targets Hrungul with an effect against which he critically succeeds at the saving throw

Effect Hrungul's defense displays his effortless military skill, unsettling the triggering foe. He attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the foe, using his Warfare Lore skill modifier in place of his Intimidation skill.

Quick Block.name: Quick Block
Quick Block.description: At the start of his turn, Hrungul gains an additional reaction that he can use only to Shield Block.

Anarchic Living Graffiti.name: 混沌活涂鸦 Anarchic Living Graffiti

Backdrop.name: 背景板 Backdrop
Backdrop.description: 当有生物尝试打击活涂鸦并且大失败时，攻击者会命中活涂鸦身后的表面。

Surface-Bound.name: 困于表面 Surface-Bound
Surface-Bound.description: 活涂鸦仅能沿着平坦表面移动。若它所处的表面被破坏，活涂鸦就会承受1d6点伤害并且转移至最近的平坦表面上。若周围5尺射程内没有平坦表面，活涂鸦就会被摧毁。

Splatter.name: 颜料喷溅 Splatter
Splatter.description: 活涂鸦用它的颜料打击将颜料喷溅到1个生物的脸上。命中时，目标@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]1轮，或直至它以交互动作移除自己脸上的颜料为止。

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The Blacknoon apprentice deals an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Toxic Treachery.name: Toxic Treachery
Toxic Treachery.description:
Trigger The Blacknoon apprentice successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralizes} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.21WIfSu7Xd7uKqV8]{Tumbles Through} a foe

Effect The Blacknoon apprentice applies a dose of poison to a weapon they wield.

Mist Projector Trap.name: Mist Projector Trap
Mist Projector Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:27] (expert) to deactivate the trap without its control key or @Check[crafting|dc:26] to create and apply a chemical that neutralizes the gas.
Mist Projector Trap.hazarddescription: Hidden jets expel gas that quickly freezes, causing limited damage to nearby books.

Icy Mist.name: Icy Mist
Icy Mist.description:
Trigger The northeast bookshelf is touched

Effect Freezing mist fills a @Template[cone|distance:30] originating from the room's northeast corner. Creatures in the area take @Damage[5d8[cold]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic]). Creatures who fail or critically fail the saving throw take @Damage[2d8[persistent,cold]] damage for up to 3 rounds. The affected area is filled with mist that functions as obscuring mist for 3 rounds.

Ansestor Statue.name: Ansestor Statue
Ansestor Statue.publicNotes:
Animated statues are often used to guard crypts, small shrines, or areas in government buildings where they can be positioned amid normal statues to hide their true nature until an intruder arouses their ire. Adventurers' suspicions regarding statues suddenly animating and attacking has led many less scrupulous adventurers to automatically attack any statues they encounter, ruining harmless, ancient relics.

Granted a semblance of life through the use of rituals or other strange magic, animated objects take many forms and serve a variety of uses. A few examples of typical animated objects are listed below. Many of these creatures serve as guardians, surprising unsuspecting adventurers when they suddenly attack. Others serve as idle distractions for the exceptionally rich, simple servants created to handle odd jobs, and the like.

Construct Armor (Hardness 6).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 6)
Construct Armor (Hardness 6).description:
Like normal objects, an animated statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once an elite animated statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 17.

Infused Items.name: Infused Items
Infused Items.description: Ashrin carries the following infused items, which last for 24 hours or until the next time he makes his daily preparations: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gWr4q4HiyGhETA8H]{Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)} (6), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.c21stU5rhN4F2fZl]{Elixir of Life (Moderate)} (2), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.2pfEtA97lpG93kG2]{Sulfur Bomb (Moderate)} (6)

Demon Touched.name: Demon Touched
Demon Touched.description: Ashrin is a puppet of the demon Kaivirris. He's harmed by spirit damage as if he were a fiend.

Fiendish Infusion.name: Fiendish Infusion
Fiendish Infusion.description:
Requirements Ashrin has a free hand

Effect Ashrin Interacts to draw a bomb, then funnels abyssal energy from Kaivirris into that bomb. Until the end of Ashrin's turn, the bomb deals an extra @Damage[3d8[void]] damage.

Intuit Object.name: Intuit Object
Intuit Object.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect By concentrating their psychic energy on a held object, the munavri intuits its use and understands how to effectively wield it. The munavri chooses one item they're holding. They gain the trained proficiency rank in one statistic required to use that item, but only for the purpose of using that specific item. For example, they could become trained in greatswords (to use a specific greatsword) or Acrobatics (to use a jade cat talisman). This benefit lasts for 1 hour.

Invertebrate Infiltrator Trap.name: Invertebrate Infiltrator Trap
Invertebrate Infiltrator Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:28] (expert) twice to suppress the trap's trigger, or @Check[occultism|dc:28] (expert) to create a ward against the trap's mental effects.
Invertebrate Infiltrator Trap.hazarddescription:
Variant confounding betrayal

Allies appear to shed their skin, transforming into either giant worm monsters or masses of wriggling worms.
Invertebrate Infiltrator Trap.routine:
(1 action, illusion, incapacitation, occult) The haunt continues to confound victims' senses and inspire them to commit violence against each other. Each creature in the haunt's area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:26].

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is confused for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is confused for 1 minute.
Invertebrate Infiltrator Trap.reset: The haunt deactivates 1 minute after all creatures leave the area but resets immediately thereafter.

Unmask.name: Unmask
Unmask.description:
Trigger Two or more creatures enter the haunt's area.

Effect Each creature sees the forms of nearby creatures shift and change, appearing to transform into fiendish or aberrant beings with a thirst for blood. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30] save.

Critical Success The creature sees through the illusions entirely and is temporarily immune to the haunt's routine for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected by the strange images.

Failure The creature believes the illusions to be true; if they become confused by the haunt's routine, they can't attempt flat checks to end the confused condition when they take damage.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is left with a lingering suspicion of others and can't benefit from Aid reactions for 24 hours.

Riled by Disrespect.name: 不敬怒火 Riled by Disrespect
Riled by Disrespect.description: 若有生物连至少一项美化先祖回响被束缚之地的任务都没有执行过的话，先祖回响对抗该生物时的攻击检定和豁免检定DC获得+1状态加值。这适用于在清洁区域D2的一次或多次检定中未曾成功过的任何PC。

Site Bound.name: 束缚之地 Site Bound
Site Bound.description: 先祖回响无法离开上层墓室。

Rejuvenation.name: 复生 Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: 修复被篡改的铭文并吟诵修正后的他们的故事，引领这些精魂前往来世。

Oh, If Your Ancestors Could See You!.name: 哎，要是你的老祖宗看到你！ Oh, If Your Ancestors Could See You!
Oh, If Your Ancestors Could See You!.description: 弗伽兹对其他矮人的严苛要求近乎无法达成，他的攻击承载着上百个世代的评判。他的打击对矮人造成额外@Damage[1d4[mental]]伤害。

Riled by Disrespect.name: 不敬怒火 Riled by Disrespect
Riled by Disrespect.description: 若有生物连至少一项美化先祖回响被束缚之地的任务都没有执行过的话，先祖回响对抗该生物时的攻击检定和豁免检定DC获得+1状态加值。这适用于在清洁区域D2的一次或多次检定中未曾成功过的任何PC。

Site Bound.name: 束缚之地 Site Bound
Site Bound.description: 先祖回响无法离开上层墓室。

Rejuvenation.name: 复生 Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: 修复被篡改的铭文并吟诵修正后的他们的故事，引领这些精魂前往来世。

Dart Launcher.name: 飞镖发射器 Dart Launcher
Dart Launcher.hazarddescription: 一连串隐藏起来的发射管对着5尺方格发射有毒飞镖。

Dart Volley.name: 飞镖齐射 Dart Volley
Dart Volley.description:
触发 压力施加在地砖上

效果 陷阱在单次攻击中发射4个飞镖。

Caustic Gas Trap.name: Caustic Gas Trap
Caustic Gas Trap.disable: @Check[crafting|dc:28] (master) to neutralize the acid or @Check[thievery|dc:30] (master) to disable the pressure plates
Caustic Gas Trap.hazarddescription: Pressure plates in the hall trigger the release of caustic gas.
Caustic Gas Trap.reset: A 10-minute Interact activity and a new supply of caustic gas.

Collapse.name: Collapse
Collapse.description:
Trigger A creature in contact with the ground travels down this hall

Effect Caustic gas fills the hall, dealing @Damage[(4d10+26)[acid]] damage to all creatures in area D5 (@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic] save).

Dwarven Monster Hunter.name: Dwarven Monster Hunter
Dwarven Monster Hunter.publicNotes:
Some mercenaries eschew the complications of politics, oaths of service, and fealty and just get paid to hunt monsters. It's a straightforward form of mercenary service, often dangerous in the extreme, but one that can yield glory and fame.

A broad category that includes those wielding arms, spells, or even guile and cunning, mercenaries hire themselves and their expertise to those with the gold to pay for it.

Rage.name: Rage
Rage.description:
Requirements The monster hunter isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or raging

Effect The monster hunter gains 9 temporary Hit Points that last until the rage ends. While raging, they deal 8 additional damage with melee attacks, gain a +10-foot status bonus to their Speed, and take a -1 penalty to AC. The monster hunter can't use concentrate actions except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} and rage actions.

The rage lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies the monster hunter can perceive, or until the monster hunter falls unconscious.

Once the rage ends, the monster hunter can't again for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Effect: Rage}

Sudden Charge.name: Sudden Charge
Sudden Charge.description: The monster hunter Strides twice and makes a melee Strike.

Troop Movement.name: Troop Movement
Troop Movement.description: Whenever a troop Strides, it first Forms Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by–20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then moves up to its Speed. See Bestiary 3 for further details.

Wild Swing.name: Wild Swing
Wild Swing.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The cultists chaotically swing their weapons—from pixies' tiny rapiers to redcaps' scythes—at each enemy adjacent to the troop (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save), dealing a small amount of damage to the troop at the same time. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d12+1)[slashing]] damage to enemies and @Damage[1d4[slashing]] damage to the troop

2 @Damage[(2d12+1)[slashing]] damage and @Damage[(1d4+2)[slashing]] damage to the troop

3 @Damage[(2d12+5)[slashing]] damage and @Damage[2d4[slashing]] damage to the troop

Sporeborn Sheep.name: 孢植羊尸 Sporeborn Sheep
Sporeborn Sheep.publicNotes:
瘟疫丧尸感染了可怕的传染病。

丧尸唯一的欲求便是啃食活物。丧尸作为永不停歇地蹒跚前行且不会思考的死亡之兆，只有将其摧毁才能使之停步。

Headless.name: 无头 Headless
Headless.description: 无头孢植羊尸无法做出啃咬攻击。

Slow.name: 缓慢 Slow
Slow.description: 丧尸具有永久性的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}且无法使用反应动作。

Wasting Wheeze.name: 枯竭哀鸣 Wasting Wheeze
Wasting Wheeze.description:
频率 每[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Wasting Wheeze]]{1d4轮}一次

触发 无头孢植羊尸受到重击或生命值降低至0点

效果 无头孢植羊尸通过颈部喷出一团孢子云。相邻活物若未能成功通过@Check[fortitude|dc:18]豁免，则承受@Damage[1d6[poison]]伤害并且陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

Zombie Rot.name: 尸化瘟疫 Zombie Rot
Zombie Rot.description:
被感染的生物直至疾病被治愈之前，无法治疗由尸化瘟疫造成的伤害。

豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

阶段1 受体无不良反应（1天）

阶段2 @Damage[1d6[void]]伤害（1天）

阶段3 @Damage[1d6[void]]伤害（1天）

阶段4 @Damage[1d6[void]]伤害（1天）

阶段5 死亡，并立即作为瘟疫丧尸复生

Caligni Assassin.name: Caligni Assassin
Caligni Assassin.publicNotes:
Lauded and shunned, caligni assassins often become unwitting pawns in clashes between caligni settlements or between rival factions of caligni society.

Calignis often get stereotyped as murderers, but the title of assassin is one of the rarest in their society. Caligni settlements go decades without having offspring born with enough potential. However, once a child shows they have "the gift"; the settlements leaders might give the babe to the owb, who mold and shape the child into an instrument of shadows and death.

Shadowfade

Caligni assassins gain their power from an infusion of planar essence directly from the Netherworld, which the owb help them develop into powerful abilities. This comes at a cost: all caligni assassins eventually succumb to an affliction known as shadowfade. This magical malady causes the caligni's body to painfully warp when concealed in shadows, as the plane's ability to create twisted reflections of reality changes their physical form directly.

Sometimes a caligni assassin will flee home and strike out on their own to avoid becoming a twisted tool for their greedy leaders. Such freelancers are in high demand for those seeking a fatal solution to their own political problems.

Shadow Shift.name: Shadow Shift
Shadow Shift.description: Caligni assassins are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} in dim light or darkness even to creatures that can see clearly in those light levels.

Swift Sneak.name: Swift Sneak
Swift Sneak.description: The assassin can move their full speed while Sneaking.

Countershadow.name: Countershadow
Countershadow.description:
Trigger A creature within 60 feet casts a light spell

Effect The caligni assassin attempts to counteract the triggering spell. Caligni assassins automatically recognize light spells.

Death Umbral Shroud.name: Death Umbral Shroud
Death Umbral Shroud.description: When a caligni assassin dies, their body disintegrates into a veil of supernatural darkness for 1 round. A 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4GE2ZdODgIQtg51c]{Darkness} spell appears, centered on the assassin's location, with a counteract DC of 23.

Deny Advantage.name: Deny Advantage
Deny Advantage.description: The assassin isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures of 8th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, undetected, flanking, or using surprise attack.

Quick Draw.name: Quick Draw
Quick Draw.description: You draw your weapon and attack with the same motion. You Interact to draw a weapon, then Strike with that weapon.

Shadow Leap.name: Shadow Leap
Shadow Leap.description:
Requirements The assassin is in dim light or darkness

Effect The assassin vanishes into shadow, appearing in a square of dim light or darkness within 60 feet. If the assassin appears adjacent to a creature, they can Strike that creature, otherwise the assassin can Hide.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The assassin deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Umbral Veil.name: Umbral Veil
Umbral Veil.description:
Requirements The assassin's last action was a successful melee Strike

Effect The assassin extends a tendril of shadow to obscure the target's vision, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{blinding} them for 1 round (@Check[will|dc:23] negates). On a critical failure, they're blind for 1 minute. Creatures with greater darkvision are immune to this ability.

label: 巡天王冢 Sky King's Tomb
